name: Genesis 1:1
text: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

name: Genesis 1:2
text: Now the earth was formless and empty. Darkness was on the surface of the deep. God"s Spirit was hovering over the surface of the waters.

name: Genesis 1:3
text: God said, "Let there be light," and there was light.

name: Genesis 1:4
text: God saw the light, and saw that it was good. God divided the light from the darkness.

name: Genesis 1:5
text: God called the light "day," and the darkness he called "night." There was evening and there was morning, one day.

name: Genesis 1:6
text: God said, "Let there be an expanse in the middle of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters."

name: Genesis 1:7
text: God made the expanse, and divided the waters which were under the expanse from the waters which were above the expanse; and it was so.

name: Genesis 1:8
text: God called the expanse "sky." There was evening and there was morning, a second day.

name: Genesis 1:9
text: God said, "Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear;" and it was so.

name: Genesis 1:10
text: God called the dry land "earth," and the gathering together of the waters he called "seas." God saw that it was good.

name: Genesis 1:11
text: God said, "Let the earth yield grass, herbs yielding seed, and fruit trees bearing fruit after their kind, with its seed in it, on the earth;" and it was so.

name: Genesis 1:12
text: The earth yielded grass, herbs yielding seed after their kind, and trees bearing fruit, with its seed in it, after their kind; and God saw that it was good.

name: Genesis 1:13
text: There was evening and there was morning, a third day.

name: Genesis 1:14
text: God said, "Let there be lights in the expanse of sky to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days and years;

name: Genesis 1:15
text: and let them be for lights in the expanse of sky to give light on the earth;" and it was so.

name: Genesis 1:16
text: God made the two great lights: the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night. He also made the stars.

name: Genesis 1:17
text: God set them in the expanse of sky to give light to the earth,

name: Genesis 1:18
text: and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness. God saw that it was good.

name: Genesis 1:19
text: There was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.

name: Genesis 1:20
text: God said, "Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open expanse of sky."

name: Genesis 1:21
text: God created the large sea creatures, and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarmed, after their kind, and every winged bird after its kind. God saw that it was good.

name: Genesis 1:22
text: God blessed them, saying, "Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let birds multiply on the earth."

name: Genesis 1:23
text: There was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.

name: Genesis 1:24
text: God said, "Let the earth produce living creatures after their kind, livestock, creeping things, and animals of the earth after their kind;" and it was so.

name: Genesis 1:25
text: God made the animals of the earth after their kind, and the livestock after their kind, and everything that creeps on the ground after its kind. God saw that it was good.

name: Genesis 1:26
text: God said, "Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the birds of the sky, and over the livestock, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth."

name: Genesis 1:27
text: God created man in his own image. In God"s image he created him; male and female he created them.

name: Genesis 1:28
text: God blessed them. God said to them, "Be fruitful, multiply, fill the earth, and subdue it. Have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the sky, and over every living thing that moves on the earth."

name: Genesis 1:29
text: God said, "Behold, I have given you every herb yielding seed, which is on the surface of all the earth, and every tree, which bears fruit yielding seed. It will be your food.

name: Genesis 1:30
text: To every animal of the earth, and to every bird of the sky, and to everything that creeps on the earth, in which there is life, I have given every green herb for food;" and it was so.

name: Genesis 1:31
text: God saw everything that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. There was evening and there was morning, a sixth day.

name: Genesis 2:1
text: The heavens and the earth were finished, and all their vast array.

name: Genesis 2:2
text: On the seventh day God finished his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.

name: Genesis 2:3
text: God blessed the seventh day, and made it holy, because he rested in it from all his work which he had created and made.

name: Genesis 2:4
text: This is the history of the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that Yahweh God made the earth and the heavens.

name: Genesis 2:5
text: No plant of the field was yet in the earth, and no herb of the field had yet sprung up; for Yahweh God had not caused it to rain on the earth. There was not a man to till the ground,

name: Genesis 2:6
text: but a mist went up from the earth, and watered the whole surface of the ground.

name: Genesis 2:7
text: Yahweh God formed man from the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

name: Genesis 2:8
text: Yahweh God planted a garden eastward, in Eden, and there he put the man whom he had formed.

name: Genesis 2:9
text: Out of the ground Yahweh God made every tree to grow that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the middle of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

name: Genesis 2:10
text: A river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from there it was parted, and became four heads.

name: Genesis 2:11
text: The name of the first is Pishon: this is the one which flows through the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;

name: Genesis 2:12
text: and the gold of that land is good. There is aromatic resin and the onyx stone.

name: Genesis 2:13
text: The name of the second river is Gihon: the same river that flows through the whole land of Cush.

name: Genesis 2:14
text: The name of the third river is Hiddekel: this is the one which flows in front of Assyria. The fourth river is the Euphrates.

name: Genesis 2:15
text: Yahweh God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

name: Genesis 2:16
text: Yahweh God commanded the man, saying, "Of every tree of the garden you may freely eat;

name: Genesis 2:17
text: but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, you shall not eat of it; for in the day that you eat of it you will surely die."

name: Genesis 2:18
text: Yahweh God said, "It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him a helper suitable for him."

name: Genesis 2:19
text: Out of the ground Yahweh God formed every animal of the field, and every bird of the sky, and brought them to the man to see what he would call them. Whatever the man called every living creature, that was its name.

name: Genesis 2:20
text: The man gave names to all livestock, and to the birds of the sky, and to every animal of the field; but for man there was not found a helper suitable for him.

name: Genesis 2:21
text: Yahweh God caused a deep sleep to fall on the man, and he slept; and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh in its place.

name: Genesis 2:22
text: He made the rib, which Yahweh God had taken from the man, into a woman, and brought her to the man.

name: Genesis 2:23
text: The man said, "This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She will be called "woman," because she was taken out of Man."

name: Genesis 2:24
text: Therefore a man will leave his father and his mother, and will join with his wife, and they will be one flesh.

name: Genesis 2:25
text: They were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.

name: Genesis 3:1
text: Now the serpent was more subtle than any animal of the field which Yahweh God had made. He said to the woman, "Has God really said, "You shall not eat of any tree of the garden?""

name: Genesis 3:2
text: The woman said to the serpent, "Of the fruit of the trees of the garden we may eat,

name: Genesis 3:3
text: but of the fruit of the tree which is in the middle of the garden, God has said, "You shall not eat of it, neither shall you touch it, lest you die.""

name: Genesis 3:4
text: The serpent said to the woman, "You won"t surely die,

name: Genesis 3:5
text: for God knows that in the day you eat it, your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil."

name: Genesis 3:6
text: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took of its fruit, and ate; and she gave some to her husband with her, and he ate.

name: Genesis 3:7
text: The eyes of both of them were opened, and they knew that they were naked. They sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.

name: Genesis 3:8
text: They heard the voice of Yahweh God walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of Yahweh God among the trees of the garden.

name: Genesis 3:9
text: Yahweh God called to the man, and said to him, "Where are you?"

name: Genesis 3:10
text: The man said, "I heard your voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself."

name: Genesis 3:11
text: God said, "Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?"

name: Genesis 3:12
text: The man said, "The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I ate."

name: Genesis 3:13
text: Yahweh God said to the woman, "What is this you have done?" The woman said, "The serpent deceived me, and I ate."

name: Genesis 3:14
text: Yahweh God said to the serpent, "Because you have done this, you are cursed above all livestock, and above every animal of the field. On your belly you shall go, and you shall eat dust all the days of your life.

name: Genesis 3:15
text: I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your offspring and her offspring. He will bruise your head, and you will bruise his heel."

name: Genesis 3:16
text: To the woman he said, "I will greatly multiply your pain in childbirth. In pain you will bear children. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you."

name: Genesis 3:17
text: To Adam he said, "Because you have listened to your wife"s voice, and have eaten of the tree, of which I commanded you, saying, "You shall not eat of it," cursed is the ground for your sake. In toil you will eat of it all the days of your life.

name: Genesis 3:18
text: It will yield thorns and thistles to you; and you will eat the herb of the field.

name: Genesis 3:19
text: By the sweat of your face will you eat bread until you return to the ground, for out of it you were taken. For you are dust, and to dust you shall return."

name: Genesis 3:20
text: The man called his wife Eve, because she was the mother of all living.

name: Genesis 3:21
text: Yahweh God made coats of skins for Adam and for his wife, and clothed them.

name: Genesis 3:22
text: Yahweh God said, "Behold, the man has become like one of us, knowing good and evil. Now, lest he reach out his hand, and also take of the tree of life, and eat, and live forever..."

name: Genesis 3:23
text: Therefore Yahweh God sent him out from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from which he was taken.

name: Genesis 3:24
text: So he drove out the man; and he placed Cherubs at the east of the garden of Eden, and the flame of a sword which turned every way, to guard the way to the tree of life.

name: Genesis 4:1
text: The man knew Eve his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Cain, and said, "I have gotten a man with Yahweh"s help."

name: Genesis 4:2
text: Again she gave birth, to Cain"s brother Abel. Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.

name: Genesis 4:3
text: As time passed, it happened that Cain brought an offering to Yahweh from the fruit of the ground.

name: Genesis 4:4
text: Abel also brought some of the firstborn of his flock and of its fat. Yahweh respected Abel and his offering,

name: Genesis 4:5
text: but he didn"t respect Cain and his offering. Cain was very angry, and the expression on his face fell.

name: Genesis 4:6
text: Yahweh said to Cain, "Why are you angry? Why has the expression of your face fallen?

name: Genesis 4:7
text: If you do well, will it not be lifted up? If you don"t do well, sin crouches at the door. Its desire is for you, but you are to rule over it."

name: Genesis 4:8
text: Cain said to Abel, his brother, "Let"s go into the field." It happened when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel, his brother, and killed him.

name: Genesis 4:9
text: Yahweh said to Cain, "Where is Abel, your brother?" He said, "I don"t know. Am I my brother"s keeper?"

name: Genesis 4:10
text: Yahweh said, "What have you done? The voice of your brother"s blood cries to me from the ground.

name: Genesis 4:11
text: Now you are cursed because of the ground, which has opened its mouth to receive your brother"s blood from your hand.

name: Genesis 4:12
text: From now on, when you till the ground, it won"t yield its strength to you. You shall be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth."

name: Genesis 4:13
text: Cain said to Yahweh, "My punishment is greater than I can bear.

name: Genesis 4:14
text: Behold, you have driven me out this day from the surface of the ground. I will be hidden from your face, and I will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth. It will happen that whoever finds me will kill me."

name: Genesis 4:15
text: Yahweh said to him, "Therefore whoever slays Cain, vengeance will be taken on him sevenfold." Yahweh appointed a sign for Cain, lest any finding him should strike him.

name: Genesis 4:16
text: Cain went out from Yahweh"s presence, and lived in the land of Nod, east of Eden.

name: Genesis 4:17
text: Cain knew his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Enoch. He built a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.

name: Genesis 4:18
text: To Enoch was born Irad. Irad became the father of Mehujael. Mehujael became the father of Methushael. Methushael became the father of Lamech.

name: Genesis 4:19
text: Lamech took two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.

name: Genesis 4:20
text: Adah gave birth to Jabal, who was the father of those who dwell in tents and have livestock.

name: Genesis 4:21
text: His brother"s name was Jubal, who was the father of all who handle the harp and pipe.

name: Genesis 4:22
text: Zillah also gave birth to Tubal Cain, the forger of every cutting instrument of brass and iron. Tubal Cain"s sister was Naamah.

name: Genesis 4:23
text: Lamech said to his wives, "Adah and Zillah, hear my voice. You wives of Lamech, listen to my speech, for I have slain a man for wounding me, a young man for bruising me.

name: Genesis 4:24
text: If Cain will be avenged seven times, truly Lamech seventy-seven times."

name: Genesis 4:25
text: Adam knew his wife again. She gave birth to a son, and named him Seth, "for God has appointed me another child instead of Abel, for Cain killed him."

name: Genesis 4:26
text: There was also born a son to Seth, and he named him Enosh. Then men began to call on Yahweh"s name.

name: Genesis 5:1
text: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, he made him in God"s likeness.

name: Genesis 5:2
text: He created them male and female, and blessed them, and called their name "Adam," in the day when they were created.

name: Genesis 5:3
text: Adam lived one hundred thirty years, and became the father of a son in his own likeness, after his image, and named him Seth.

name: Genesis 5:4
text: The days of Adam after he became the father of Seth were eight hundred years, and he became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 5:5
text: All the days that Adam lived were nine hundred thirty years, then he died.

name: Genesis 5:6
text: Seth lived one hundred five years, and became the father of Enosh.

name: Genesis 5:7
text: Seth lived after he became the father of Enosh eight hundred seven years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 5:8
text: All the days of Seth were nine hundred twelve years, then he died.

name: Genesis 5:9
text: Enosh lived ninety years, and became the father of Kenan.

name: Genesis 5:10
text: Enosh lived after he became the father of Kenan, eight hundred fifteen years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 5:11
text: All the days of Enosh were nine hundred five years, then he died.

name: Genesis 5:12
text: Kenan lived seventy years, and became the father of Mahalalel.

name: Genesis 5:13
text: Kenan lived after he became the father of Mahalalel eight hundred forty years, and became the father of sons and daughters

name: Genesis 5:14
text: and all the days of Kenan were nine hundred ten years, then he died.

name: Genesis 5:15
text: Mahalalel lived sixty-five years, and became the father of Jared.

name: Genesis 5:16
text: Mahalalel lived after he became the father of Jared eight hundred thirty years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 5:17
text: All the days of Mahalalel were eight hundred ninety-five years, then he died.

name: Genesis 5:18
text: Jared lived one hundred sixty-two years, and became the father of Enoch.

name: Genesis 5:19
text: Jared lived after he became the father of Enoch eight hundred years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 5:20
text: All the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty-two years, then he died.

name: Genesis 5:21
text: Enoch lived sixty-five years, and became the father of Methuselah.

name: Genesis 5:22
text: Enoch walked with God after he became the father of Methuselah three hundred years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 5:23
text: All the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty-five years.

name: Genesis 5:24
text: Enoch walked with God, and he was not, for God took him.

name: Genesis 5:25
text: Methuselah lived one hundred eighty-seven years, and became the father of Lamech.

name: Genesis 5:26
text: Methuselah lived after he became the father of Lamech seven hundred eighty-two years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 5:27
text: All the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty-nine years, then he died.

name: Genesis 5:28
text: Lamech lived one hundred eighty-two years, and became the father of a son,

name: Genesis 5:29
text: and he named him Noah, saying, "This same will comfort us in our work and in the toil of our hands, because of the ground which Yahweh has cursed."

name: Genesis 5:30
text: Lamech lived after he became the father of Noah five hundred ninety-five years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 5:31
text: All the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy-seven years, then he died.

name: Genesis 5:32
text: Noah was five hundred years old, and Noah became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

name: Genesis 6:1
text: It happened, when men began to multiply on the surface of the ground, and daughters were born to them,

name: Genesis 6:2
text: that God"s sons saw that men"s daughters were beautiful, and they took for themselves wives of all that they chose.

name: Genesis 6:3
text: Yahweh said, "My Spirit will not strive with man forever, because he also is flesh; yet will his days be one hundred twenty years."

name: Genesis 6:4
text: The Nephilim were in the earth in those days, and also after that, when God"s sons came in to men"s daughters. They bore children to them. Those were the mighty men who were of old, men of renown.

name: Genesis 6:5
text: Yahweh saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.

name: Genesis 6:6
text: Yahweh was sorry that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him in his heart.

name: Genesis 6:7
text: Yahweh said, "I will destroy man whom I have created from the surface of the ground; man, along with animals, creeping things, and birds of the sky; for I am sorry that I have made them."

name: Genesis 6:8
text: But Noah found favor in Yahweh"s eyes.

name: Genesis 6:9
text: This is the history of the generations of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time. Noah walked with God.

name: Genesis 6:10
text: Noah became the father of three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

name: Genesis 6:11
text: The earth was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

name: Genesis 6:12
text: God saw the earth, and saw that it was corrupt, for all flesh had corrupted their way on the earth.

name: Genesis 6:13
text: God said to Noah, "The end of all flesh has come before me, for the earth is filled with violence through them. Behold, I will destroy them with the earth.

name: Genesis 6:14
text: Make a ship of gopher wood. You shall make rooms in the ship, and shall seal it inside and outside with pitch.

name: Genesis 6:15
text: This is how you shall make it. The length of the ship will be three hundred cubits, its breadth fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits.

name: Genesis 6:16
text: You shall make a roof in the ship, and you shall finish it to a cubit upward. You shall set the door of the ship in its side. You shall make it with lower, second, and third levels.

name: Genesis 6:17
text: I, even I, do bring the flood of waters on this earth, to destroy all flesh having the breath of life from under the sky. Everything that is in the earth will die.

name: Genesis 6:18
text: But I will establish my covenant with you. You shall come into the ship, you, your sons, your wife, and your sons" wives with you.

name: Genesis 6:19
text: Of every living thing of all flesh, you shall bring two of every sort into the ship, to keep them alive with you. They shall be male and female.

name: Genesis 6:20
text: Of the birds after their kind, of the livestock after their kind, of every creeping thing of the ground after its kind, two of every sort shall come to you, to keep them alive.

name: Genesis 6:21
text: Take with you of all food that is eaten, and gather it to yourself; and it will be for food for you, and for them."

name: Genesis 6:22
text: Thus Noah did. According to all that God commanded him, so he did.

name: Genesis 7:1
text: Yahweh said to Noah, "Come with all of your household into the ship, for I have seen your righteousness before me in this generation.

name: Genesis 7:2
text: You shall take seven pairs of every clean animal with you, the male and his female. Of the animals that are not clean, take two, the male and his female.

name: Genesis 7:3
text: Also of the birds of the sky, seven and seven, male and female, to keep seed alive on the surface of all the earth.

name: Genesis 7:4
text: In seven days, I will cause it to rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights. Every living thing that I have made, I will destroy from the surface of the ground."

name: Genesis 7:5
text: Noah did everything that Yahweh commanded him.

name: Genesis 7:6
text: Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came on the earth.

name: Genesis 7:7
text: Noah went into the ship with his sons, his wife, and his sons" wives, because of the waters of the flood.

name: Genesis 7:8
text: Clean animals, animals that are not clean, birds, and everything that creeps on the ground

name: Genesis 7:9
text: went by pairs to Noah into the ship, male and female, as God commanded Noah.

name: Genesis 7:10
text: It happened after the seven days, that the waters of the flood came on the earth.

name: Genesis 7:11
text: In the six hundredth year of Noah"s life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on the same day all the fountains of the great deep were burst open, and the sky"s windows were opened.

name: Genesis 7:12
text: The rain was on the earth forty days and forty nights.

name: Genesis 7:13
text: In the same day Noah, and Shem, Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah"s wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, entered into the ship;

name: Genesis 7:14
text: they, and every animal after its kind, all the livestock after their kind, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind, every bird of every sort.

name: Genesis 7:15
text: They went to Noah into the ship, by pairs of all flesh with the breath of life in them.

name: Genesis 7:16
text: Those who went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him; and Yahweh shut him in.

name: Genesis 7:17
text: The flood was forty days on the earth. The waters increased, and lifted up the ship, and it was lifted up above the earth.

name: Genesis 7:18
text: The waters prevailed, and increased greatly on the earth; and the ship floated on the surface of the waters.

name: Genesis 7:19
text: The waters prevailed exceedingly on the earth. All the high mountains that were under the whole sky were covered.

name: Genesis 7:20
text: The waters prevailed fifteen cubits upward, and the mountains were covered.

name: Genesis 7:21
text: All flesh died that moved on the earth, including birds, livestock, animals, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, and every man.

name: Genesis 7:22
text: All in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, of all that was on the dry land, died.

name: Genesis 7:23
text: Every living thing was destroyed that was on the surface of the ground, including man, livestock, creeping things, and birds of the sky. They were destroyed from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those who were with him in the ship.

name: Genesis 7:24
text: The waters prevailed on the earth one hundred fifty days.

name: Genesis 8:1
text: God remembered Noah, all the animals, and all the livestock that were with him in the ship; and God made a wind to pass over the earth. The waters subsided.

name: Genesis 8:2
text: The deep"s fountains and the sky"s windows were also stopped, and the rain from the sky was restrained.

name: Genesis 8:3
text: The waters receded from the earth continually. After the end of one hundred fifty days the waters decreased.

name: Genesis 8:4
text: The ship rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on Ararat"s mountains.

name: Genesis 8:5
text: The waters receded continually until the tenth month. In the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains were seen.

name: Genesis 8:6
text: It happened at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ship which he had made,

name: Genesis 8:7
text: and he sent out a raven. It went back and forth, until the waters were dried up from the earth.

name: Genesis 8:8
text: He sent out a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from the surface of the ground,

name: Genesis 8:9
text: but the dove found no place to rest her foot, and she returned to him into the ship; for the waters were on the surface of the whole earth. He put out his hand, and took her, and brought her to him into the ship.

name: Genesis 8:10
text: He stayed yet another seven days; and again he sent the dove out of the ship.

name: Genesis 8:11
text: The dove came back to him at evening, and, behold, in her mouth was an olive leaf plucked off. So Noah knew that the waters were abated from the earth.

name: Genesis 8:12
text: He stayed yet another seven days, and sent out the dove; and she didn"t return to him any more.

name: Genesis 8:13
text: It happened in the six hundred first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from the earth. Noah removed the covering of the ship, and looked. He saw that the surface of the ground was dried.

name: Genesis 8:14
text: In the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.

name: Genesis 8:15
text: God spoke to Noah, saying,

name: Genesis 8:16
text: "Go out of the ship, you, and your wife, and your sons, and your sons" wives with you.

name: Genesis 8:17
text: Bring out with you every living thing that is with you of all flesh, including birds, livestock, and every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply on the earth."

name: Genesis 8:18
text: Noah went out, with his sons, his wife, and his sons" wives with him.

name: Genesis 8:19
text: Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, whatever moves on the earth, after their families, went out of the ship.

name: Genesis 8:20
text: Noah built an altar to Yahweh, and took of every clean animal, and of every clean bird, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.

name: Genesis 8:21
text: Yahweh smelled the pleasant aroma. Yahweh said in his heart, "I will not again curse the ground any more for man"s sake, because the imagination of man"s heart is evil from his youth; neither will I ever again strike everything living, as I have done.

name: Genesis 8:22
text: While the earth remains, seed time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease."

name: Genesis 9:1
text: God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, "Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.

name: Genesis 9:2
text: The fear of you and the dread of you will be on every animal of the earth, and on every bird of the sky. Everything that the ground teems with, and all the fish of the sea are delivered into your hand.

name: Genesis 9:3
text: Every moving thing that lives will be food for you. As the green herb, I have given everything to you.

name: Genesis 9:4
text: But flesh with its life, its blood, you shall not eat.

name: Genesis 9:5
text: I will surely require your blood of your lives. At the hand of every animal I will require it. At the hand of man, even at the hand of every man"s brother, I will require the life of man.

name: Genesis 9:6
text: Whoever sheds man"s blood, his blood will be shed by man, for God made man in his own image.

name: Genesis 9:7
text: Be fruitful and multiply. Increase abundantly in the earth, and multiply in it."

name: Genesis 9:8
text: God spoke to Noah and to his sons with him, saying,

name: Genesis 9:9
text: "As for me, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your offspring after you,

name: Genesis 9:10
text: and with every living creature that is with you: the birds, the livestock, and every animal of the earth with you, of all that go out of the ship, even every animal of the earth.

name: Genesis 9:11
text: I will establish my covenant with you: all flesh will not be cut off any more by the waters of the flood, neither will there ever again be a flood to destroy the earth."

name: Genesis 9:12
text: God said, "This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:

name: Genesis 9:13
text: I set my rainbow in the cloud, and it will be for a sign of a covenant between me and the earth.

name: Genesis 9:14
text: It will happen, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the rainbow will be seen in the cloud,

name: Genesis 9:15
text: and I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh, and the waters will no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.

name: Genesis 9:16
text: The rainbow will be in the cloud. I will look at it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is on the earth."

name: Genesis 9:17
text: God said to Noah, "This is the token of the covenant which I have established between me and all flesh that is on the earth."

name: Genesis 9:18
text: The sons of Noah who went out from the ship were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Ham is the father of Canaan.

name: Genesis 9:19
text: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these, the whole earth was populated.

name: Genesis 9:20
text: Noah began to be a farmer, and planted a vineyard.

name: Genesis 9:21
text: He drank of the wine and got drunk. He was uncovered within his tent.

name: Genesis 9:22
text: Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brothers outside.

name: Genesis 9:23
text: Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it on both their shoulders, went in backwards, and covered the nakedness of their father. Their faces were backwards, and they didn"t see their father"s nakedness.

name: Genesis 9:24
text: Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his youngest son had done to him.

name: Genesis 9:25
text: He said, "Canaan is cursed. He will be servant of servants to his brothers."

name: Genesis 9:26
text: He said, "Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Shem. Let Canaan be his servant.

name: Genesis 9:27
text: May God enlarge Japheth. Let him dwell in the tents of Shem. Let Canaan be his servant."

name: Genesis 9:28
text: Noah lived three hundred fifty years after the flood.

name: Genesis 9:29
text: All the days of Noah were nine hundred fifty years, then he died.

name: Genesis 10:1
text: Now this is the history of the generations of the sons of Noah and of Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.

name: Genesis 10:2
text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

name: Genesis 10:3
text: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

name: Genesis 10:4
text: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

name: Genesis 10:5
text: Of these were the islands of the nations divided in their lands, everyone after his language, after their families, in their nations.

name: Genesis 10:6
text: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

name: Genesis 10:7
text: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

name: Genesis 10:8
text: Cush became the father of Nimrod. He began to be a mighty one in the earth.

name: Genesis 10:9
text: He was a mighty hunter before Yahweh. Therefore it is said, "Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before Yahweh."

name: Genesis 10:10
text: The beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.

name: Genesis 10:11
text: Out of that land he went into Assyria, and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah,

name: Genesis 10:12
text: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah (the same is the great city).

name: Genesis 10:13
text: Mizraim became the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,

name: Genesis 10:14
text: Pathrusim, Casluhim (which the Philistines descended from), and Caphtorim.

name: Genesis 10:15
text: Canaan became the father of Sidon (his firstborn), Heth,

name: Genesis 10:16
text: the Jebusite, the Amorite, the Girgashite,

name: Genesis 10:17
text: the Hivite, the Arkite, the Sinite,

name: Genesis 10:18
text: the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite. Afterward the families of the Canaanites were spread abroad.

name: Genesis 10:19
text: The border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as you go toward Gerar, to Gaza; as you go toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, to Lasha.

name: Genesis 10:20
text: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their languages, in their lands, in their nations.

name: Genesis 10:21
text: To Shem, the father of all the children of Eber, the elder brother of Japheth, to him also were children born.

name: Genesis 10:22
text: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.

name: Genesis 10:23
text: The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.

name: Genesis 10:24
text: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah. Shelah became the father of Eber.

name: Genesis 10:25
text: To Eber were born two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided. His brother"s name was Joktan.

name: Genesis 10:26
text: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

name: Genesis 10:27
text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

name: Genesis 10:28
text: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

name: Genesis 10:29
text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

name: Genesis 10:30
text: Their dwelling was from Mesha, as you go toward Sephar, the mountain of the east.

name: Genesis 10:31
text: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their languages, in their lands, after their nations.

name: Genesis 10:32
text: These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations, in their nations. Of these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.

name: Genesis 11:1
text: The whole earth was of one language and of one speech.

name: Genesis 11:2
text: It happened, as they traveled east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and they lived there.

name: Genesis 11:3
text: They said one to another, "Come, let"s make bricks, and burn them thoroughly." They had brick for stone, and they used tar for mortar.

name: Genesis 11:4
text: They said, "Come, let"s build ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to the sky, and let"s make ourselves a name, lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth."

name: Genesis 11:5
text: Yahweh came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men built.

name: Genesis 11:6
text: Yahweh said, "Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language, and this is what they begin to do. Now nothing will be withheld from them, which they intend to do.

name: Genesis 11:7
text: Come, let"s go down, and there confuse their language, that they may not understand one another"s speech."

name: Genesis 11:8
text: So Yahweh scattered them abroad from there on the surface of all the earth. They stopped building the city.

name: Genesis 11:9
text: Therefore its name was called Babel, because there Yahweh confused the language of all the earth. From there, Yahweh scattered them abroad on the surface of all the earth.

name: Genesis 11:10
text: This is the history of the generations of Shem. Shem was one hundred years old and became the father of Arpachshad two years after the flood.

name: Genesis 11:11
text: Shem lived five hundred years after he became the father of Arpachshad, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 11:12
text: Arpachshad lived thirty-five years and became the father of Shelah.

name: Genesis 11:13
text: Arpachshad lived four hundred three years after he became the father of Shelah, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 11:14
text: Shelah lived thirty years, and became the father of Eber:

name: Genesis 11:15
text: and Shelah lived four hundred three years after he became the father of Eber, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 11:16
text: Eber lived thirty-four years, and became the father of Peleg.

name: Genesis 11:17
text: Eber lived four hundred thirty years after he became the father of Peleg, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 11:18
text: Peleg lived thirty years, and became the father of Reu.

name: Genesis 11:19
text: Peleg lived two hundred nine years after he became the father of Reu, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 11:20
text: Reu lived thirty-two years, and became the father of Serug.

name: Genesis 11:21
text: Reu lived two hundred seven years after he became the father of Serug, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 11:22
text: Serug lived thirty years, and became the father of Nahor.

name: Genesis 11:23
text: Serug lived two hundred years after he became the father of Nahor, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 11:24
text: Nahor lived twenty-nine years, and became the father of Terah.

name: Genesis 11:25
text: Nahor lived one hundred nineteen years after he became the father of Terah, and became the father of sons and daughters.

name: Genesis 11:26
text: Terah lived seventy years, and became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

name: Genesis 11:27
text: Now this is the history of the generations of Terah. Terah became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran. Haran became the father of Lot.

name: Genesis 11:28
text: Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his birth, in Ur of the Chaldees.

name: Genesis 11:29
text: Abram and Nahor took wives. The name of Abram"s wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor"s wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran who was also the father of Iscah.

name: Genesis 11:30
text: Sarai was barren. She had no child.

name: Genesis 11:31
text: Terah took Abram his son, Lot the son of Haran, his son"s son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram"s wife. They went from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan. They came to Haran and lived there.

name: Genesis 11:32
text: The days of Terah were two hundred five years. Terah died in Haran.

name: Genesis 12:1
text: Now Yahweh said to Abram, "Get out of your country, and from your relatives, and from your father"s house, to the land that I will show you.

name: Genesis 12:2
text: I will make of you a great nation. I will bless you and make your name great. You will be a blessing.

name: Genesis 12:3
text: I will bless those who bless you, and I will curse him who curses you. All of the families of the earth will be blessed in you."

name: Genesis 12:4
text: So Abram went, as Yahweh had spoken to him. Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he departed out of Haran.

name: Genesis 12:5
text: Abram took Sarai his wife, Lot his brother"s son, all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls whom they had gotten in Haran, and they went to go into the land of Canaan. Into the land of Canaan they came.

name: Genesis 12:6
text: Abram passed through the land to the place of Shechem, to the oak of Moreh. The Canaanite was then in the land.

name: Genesis 12:7
text: Yahweh appeared to Abram and said, "I will give this land to your seed." He built an altar there to Yahweh, who appeared to him.

name: Genesis 12:8
text: He left from there to the mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Ai on the east. There he built an altar to Yahweh and called on the name of Yahweh.

name: Genesis 12:9
text: Abram traveled, going on still toward the South.

name: Genesis 12:10
text: There was a famine in the land. Abram went down into Egypt to live as a foreigner there, for the famine was severe in the land.

name: Genesis 12:11
text: It happened, when he had come near to enter Egypt, that he said to Sarai his wife, "See now, I know that you are a beautiful woman to look at.

name: Genesis 12:12
text: It will happen, when the Egyptians will see you, that they will say, "This is his wife." They will kill me, but they will save you alive.

name: Genesis 12:13
text: Please say that you are my sister, that it may be well with me for your sake, and that my soul may live because of you."

name: Genesis 12:14
text: It happened that when Abram had come into Egypt, the Egyptians saw that the woman was very beautiful.

name: Genesis 12:15
text: The princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh; and the woman was taken into Pharaoh"s house.

name: Genesis 12:16
text: He dealt well with Abram for her sake. He had sheep, cattle, male donkeys, male servants, female servants, female donkeys, and camels.

name: Genesis 12:17
text: Yahweh plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram"s wife.

name: Genesis 12:18
text: Pharaoh called Abram and said, "What is this that you have done to me? Why didn"t you tell me that she was your wife?

name: Genesis 12:19
text: Why did you say, "She is my sister," so that I took her to be my wife? Now therefore, see your wife, take her, and go your way."

name: Genesis 12:20
text: Pharaoh commanded men concerning him, and they brought him on the way with his wife and all that he had.

name: Genesis 13:1
text: Abram went up out of Egypt: he, his wife, all that he had, and Lot with him, into the South.

name: Genesis 13:2
text: Abram was very rich in livestock, in silver, and in gold.

name: Genesis 13:3
text: He went on his journeys from the South even to Bethel, to the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai,

name: Genesis 13:4
text: to the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first. There Abram called on the name of Yahweh.

name: Genesis 13:5
text: Lot also, who went with Abram, had flocks, and herds, and tents.

name: Genesis 13:6
text: The land was not able to bear them, that they might live together: for their substance was great, so that they could not live together.

name: Genesis 13:7
text: There was a strife between the herdsmen of Abram"s livestock and the herdsmen of Lot"s livestock: and the Canaanite and the Perizzite lived in the land at that time.

name: Genesis 13:8
text: Abram said to Lot, "Please, let there be no strife between me and you, and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen; for we are relatives.

name: Genesis 13:9
text: Isn"t the whole land before you? Please separate yourself from me. If you go to the left hand, then I will go to the right. Or if you go to the right hand, then I will go to the left."

name: Genesis 13:10
text: Lot lifted up his eyes, and saw all the plain of the Jordan, that it was well-watered everywhere, before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the garden of Yahweh, like the land of Egypt, as you go to Zoar.

name: Genesis 13:11
text: So Lot chose the Plain of the Jordan for himself. Lot traveled east, and they separated themselves the one from the other.

name: Genesis 13:12
text: Abram lived in the land of Canaan, and Lot lived in the cities of the plain, and moved his tent as far as Sodom.

name: Genesis 13:13
text: Now the men of Sodom were exceedingly wicked and sinners against Yahweh.

name: Genesis 13:14
text: Yahweh said to Abram, after Lot was separated from him, "Now, lift up your eyes, and look from the place where you are, northward and southward and eastward and westward,

name: Genesis 13:15
text: for all the land which you see, I will give to you, and to your offspring forever.

name: Genesis 13:16
text: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then your seed may also be numbered.

name: Genesis 13:17
text: Arise, walk through the land in its length and in its breadth; for I will give it to you."

name: Genesis 13:18
text: Abram moved his tent, and came and lived by the oaks of Mamre, which are in Hebron, and built an altar there to Yahweh.

name: Genesis 14:1
text: It happened in the days of Amraphel, king of Shinar, Arioch, king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer, king of Elam, and Tidal, king of Goiim,

name: Genesis 14:2
text: that they made war with Bera, king of Sodom, and with Birsha, king of Gomorrah, Shinab, king of Admah, and Shemeber, king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar).

name: Genesis 14:3
text: All these joined together in the valley of Siddim (the same is the Salt Sea).

name: Genesis 14:4
text: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year, they rebelled.

name: Genesis 14:5
text: In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer came, and the kings who were with him, and struck the Rephaim in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzim in Ham, and the Emim in Shaveh Kiriathaim,

name: Genesis 14:6
text: and the Horites in their Mount Seir, to Elparan, which is by the wilderness.

name: Genesis 14:7
text: They returned, and came to En Mishpat (the same is Kadesh), and struck all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that lived in Hazazon Tamar.

name: Genesis 14:8
text: The king of Sodom, and the king of Gomorrah, and the king of Admah, and the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar) went out; and they set the battle in array against them in the valley of Siddim;

name: Genesis 14:9
text: against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of Goiim, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar; four kings against the five.

name: Genesis 14:10
text: Now the valley of Siddim was full of tar pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and they fell there, and those who remained fled to the hills.

name: Genesis 14:11
text: They took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their food, and went their way.

name: Genesis 14:12
text: They took Lot, Abram"s brother"s son, who lived in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.

name: Genesis 14:13
text: One who had escaped came and told Abram, the Hebrew. Now he lived by the oaks of Mamre, the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner; and these were allies of Abram.

name: Genesis 14:14
text: When Abram heard that his relative was taken captive, he led out his trained men, born in his house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued as far as Dan.

name: Genesis 14:15
text: He divided himself against them by night, he and his servants, and struck them, and pursued them to Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus.

name: Genesis 14:16
text: He brought back all the goods, and also brought back his relative, Lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the people.

name: Genesis 14:17
text: The king of Sodom went out to meet him, after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, at the valley of Shaveh (that is, the King"s Valley).

name: Genesis 14:18
text: Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine: and he was priest of God Most High.

name: Genesis 14:19
text: He blessed him, and said, "Blessed be Abram of God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth:

name: Genesis 14:20
text: and blessed be God Most High, who has delivered your enemies into your hand." Abram gave him a tenth of all.

name: Genesis 14:21
text: The king of Sodom said to Abram, "Give me the people, and take the goods to yourself."

name: Genesis 14:22
text: Abram said to the king of Sodom, "I have lifted up my hand to Yahweh, God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth,

name: Genesis 14:23
text: that I will not take a thread nor a sandal strap nor anything that is yours, lest you should say, "I have made Abram rich."

name: Genesis 14:24
text: I will accept nothing from you except that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men who went with me: Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre. Let them take their portion."

name: Genesis 15:1
text: After these things the word of Yahweh came to Abram in a vision, saying, "Don"t be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your exceedingly great reward."

name: Genesis 15:2
text: Abram said, "Lord Yahweh, what will you give me, since I go childless, and he who will inherit my estate is Eliezer of Damascus?"

name: Genesis 15:3
text: Abram said, "Behold, to me you have given no seed: and, behold, one born in my house is my heir."

name: Genesis 15:4
text: Behold, the word of Yahweh came to him, saying, "This man will not be your heir, but he who will come out of your own body will be your heir."

name: Genesis 15:5
text: Yahweh brought him outside, and said, "Look now toward the sky, and count the stars, if you are able to count them." He said to Abram, "So shall your seed be."

name: Genesis 15:6
text: He believed in Yahweh; and he reckoned it to him for righteousness.

name: Genesis 15:7
text: He said to him, "I am Yahweh who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give you this land to inherit it."

name: Genesis 15:8
text: He said, "Lord Yahweh, how will I know that I will inherit it?"

name: Genesis 15:9
text: He said to him, "Bring me a heifer three years old, a female goat three years old, a ram three years old, a turtledove, and a young pigeon."

name: Genesis 15:10
text: He brought him all of these, and divided them in the middle, and laid each half opposite the other; but he didn"t divide the birds.

name: Genesis 15:11
text: The birds of prey came down on the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.

name: Genesis 15:12
text: When the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell on Abram. Now terror and great darkness fell on him.

name: Genesis 15:13
text: He said to Abram, "Know for sure that your seed will live as foreigners in a land that is not theirs, and will serve them. They will afflict them four hundred years.

name: Genesis 15:14
text: I will also judge that nation, whom they will serve. Afterward they will come out with great wealth,

name: Genesis 15:15
text: but you will go to your fathers in peace. You will be buried in a good old age.

name: Genesis 15:16
text: In the fourth generation they will come here again, for the iniquity of the Amorite is not yet full."

name: Genesis 15:17
text: It came to pass that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold, a smoking furnace, and a flaming torch passed between these pieces.

name: Genesis 15:18
text: In that day Yahweh made a covenant with Abram, saying, "To your seed I have given this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates:

name: Genesis 15:19
text: the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,

name: Genesis 15:20
text: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,

name: Genesis 15:21
text: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites."

name: Genesis 16:1
text: Now Sarai, Abram"s wife, bore him no children. She had a handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.

name: Genesis 16:2
text: Sarai said to Abram, "See now, Yahweh has restrained me from bearing. Please go in to my handmaid. It may be that I will obtain children by her." Abram listened to the voice of Sarai.

name: Genesis 16:3
text: Sarai, Abram"s wife, took Hagar the Egyptian, her handmaid, after Abram had lived ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to Abram her husband to be his wife.

name: Genesis 16:4
text: He went in to Hagar, and she conceived. When she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.

name: Genesis 16:5
text: Sarai said to Abram, "This wrong is your fault. I gave my handmaid into your bosom, and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes. Yahweh judge between me and you."

name: Genesis 16:6
text: But Abram said to Sarai, "Behold, your maid is in your hand. Do to her whatever is good in your eyes." Sarai dealt harshly with her, and she fled from her face.

name: Genesis 16:7
text: The angel of Yahweh found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur.

name: Genesis 16:8
text: He said, "Hagar, Sarai"s handmaid, where did you come from? Where are you going?" She said, "I am fleeing from the face of my mistress Sarai."

name: Genesis 16:9
text: The angel of Yahweh said to her, "Return to your mistress, and submit yourself under her hands."

name: Genesis 16:10
text: The angel of Yahweh said to her, "I will greatly multiply your seed, that they will not be numbered for multitude."

name: Genesis 16:11
text: The angel of Yahweh said to her, "Behold, you are with child, and will bear a son. You shall call his name Ishmael, because Yahweh has heard your affliction.

name: Genesis 16:12
text: He will be like a wild donkey among men. His hand will be against every man, and every man"s hand against him. He will live opposite all of his brothers."

name: Genesis 16:13
text: She called the name of Yahweh who spoke to her, "You are a God who sees," for she said, "Have I even stayed alive after seeing him?"

name: Genesis 16:14
text: Therefore the well was called Beer Lahai Roi. Behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.

name: Genesis 16:15
text: Hagar bore a son for Abram. Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael.

name: Genesis 16:16
text: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.

name: Genesis 17:1
text: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, Yahweh appeared to Abram, and said to him, "I am God Almighty. Walk before me, and be blameless.

name: Genesis 17:2
text: I will make my covenant between me and you, and will multiply you exceedingly."

name: Genesis 17:3
text: Abram fell on his face. God talked with him, saying,

name: Genesis 17:4
text: "As for me, behold, my covenant is with you. You will be the father of a multitude of nations.

name: Genesis 17:5
text: Neither will your name any more be called Abram, but your name will be Abraham; for I have made you the father of a multitude of nations.

name: Genesis 17:6
text: I will make you exceedingly fruitful, and I will make nations of you. Kings will come out of you.

name: Genesis 17:7
text: I will establish my covenant between me and you and your seed after you throughout their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be a God to you and to your seed after you.

name: Genesis 17:8
text: I will give to you, and to your seed after you, the land where you are traveling, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession. I will be their God."

name: Genesis 17:9
text: God said to Abraham, "As for you, you will keep my covenant, you and your seed after you throughout their generations.

name: Genesis 17:10
text: This is my covenant, which you shall keep, between me and you and your seed after you. Every male among you shall be circumcised.

name: Genesis 17:11
text: You shall be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskin. It will be a token of the covenant between me and you.

name: Genesis 17:12
text: He who is eight days old will be circumcised among you, every male throughout your generations, he who is born in the house, or bought with money from any foreigner who is not of your seed.

name: Genesis 17:13
text: He who is born in your house, and he who is bought with your money, must be circumcised. My covenant will be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.

name: Genesis 17:14
text: The uncircumcised male who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin, that soul shall be cut off from his people. He has broken my covenant."

name: Genesis 17:15
text: God said to Abraham, "As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, but her name will be Sarah.

name: Genesis 17:16
text: I will bless her, and moreover I will give you a son by her. Yes, I will bless her, and she will be a mother of nations. Kings of peoples will come from her."

name: Genesis 17:17
text: Then Abraham fell on his face, and laughed, and said in his heart, "Will a child be born to him who is one hundred years old? Will Sarah, who is ninety years old, give birth?"

name: Genesis 17:18
text: Abraham said to God, "Oh that Ishmael might live before you!"

name: Genesis 17:19
text: God said, "No, but Sarah, your wife, will bear you a son. You shall call his name Isaac. I will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant for his seed after him.

name: Genesis 17:20
text: As for Ishmael, I have heard you. Behold, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly. He will become the father of twelve princes, and I will make him a great nation.

name: Genesis 17:21
text: But my covenant I establish with Isaac, whom Sarah will bear to you at this set time next year."

name: Genesis 17:22
text: When he finished talking with him, God went up from Abraham.

name: Genesis 17:23
text: Abraham took Ishmael his son, all who were born in his house, and all who were bought with his money; every male among the men of Abraham"s house, and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the same day, as God had said to him.

name: Genesis 17:24
text: Abraham was ninety-nine years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

name: Genesis 17:25
text: Ishmael, his son, was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

name: Genesis 17:26
text: In the same day both Abraham and Ishmael, his son, were circumcised.

name: Genesis 17:27
text: All the men of his house, those born in the house, and those bought with money of a foreigner, were circumcised with him.

name: Genesis 18:1
text: Yahweh appeared to him by the oaks of Mamre, as he sat in the tent door in the heat of the day.

name: Genesis 18:2
text: He lifted up his eyes and looked, and saw that three men stood opposite him. When he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed himself to the earth,

name: Genesis 18:3
text: and said, "My lord, if now I have found favor in your sight, please don"t go away from your servant.

name: Genesis 18:4
text: Now let a little water be fetched, wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree.

name: Genesis 18:5
text: I will get a morsel of bread so you can refresh your heart. After that you may go your way, now that you have come to your servant." They said, "Very well, do as you have said."

name: Genesis 18:6
text: Abraham hurried into the tent to Sarah, and said, "Quickly prepare three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes."

name: Genesis 18:7
text: Abraham ran to the herd, and fetched a tender and good calf, and gave it to the servant. He hurried to dress it.

name: Genesis 18:8
text: He took butter, milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before them. He stood by them under the tree, and they ate.

name: Genesis 18:9
text: They asked him, "Where is Sarah, your wife?" He said, "See, in the tent."

name: Genesis 18:10
text: He said, "I will certainly return to you when the season comes round. Behold, Sarah your wife will have a son." Sarah heard in the tent door, which was behind him.

name: Genesis 18:11
text: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, well advanced in age. Sarah had passed the age of childbearing.

name: Genesis 18:12
text: Sarah laughed within herself, saying, "After I have grown old will I have pleasure, my lord being old also?"

name: Genesis 18:13
text: Yahweh said to Abraham, "Why did Sarah laugh, saying, "Will I really bear a child, yet I am old?"

name: Genesis 18:14
text: Is anything too hard for Yahweh? At the set time I will return to you, when the season comes round, and Sarah will have a son."

name: Genesis 18:15
text: Then Sarah denied, saying, "I didn"t laugh," for she was afraid. He said, "No, but you did laugh."

name: Genesis 18:16
text: The men rose up from there, and looked toward Sodom. Abraham went with them to see them on their way.

name: Genesis 18:17
text: Yahweh said, "Will I hide from Abraham what I do,

name: Genesis 18:18
text: since Abraham has surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth will be blessed in him?

name: Genesis 18:19
text: For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children and his household after him, that they may keep the way of Yahweh, to do righteousness and justice; to the end that Yahweh may bring on Abraham that which he has spoken of him."

name: Genesis 18:20
text: Yahweh said, "Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and because their sin is very grievous,

name: Genesis 18:21
text: I will go down now, and see whether their deeds are as bad as the reports which have come to me. If not, I will know."

name: Genesis 18:22
text: The men turned from there, and went toward Sodom, but Abraham stood yet before Yahweh.

name: Genesis 18:23
text: Abraham drew near, and said, "Will you consume the righteous with the wicked?

name: Genesis 18:24
text: What if there are fifty righteous within the city? Will you consume and not spare the place for the fifty righteous who are in it?

name: Genesis 18:25
text: Be it far from you to do things like that, to kill the righteous with the wicked, so that the righteous should be like the wicked. May that be far from you. Shouldn"t the Judge of all the earth do right?"

name: Genesis 18:26
text: Yahweh said, "If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sake."

name: Genesis 18:27
text: Abraham answered, "See now, I have taken it on myself to speak to the Lord, who am but dust and ashes.

name: Genesis 18:28
text: What if there will lack five of the fifty righteous? Will you destroy all the city for lack of five?" He said, "I will not destroy it, if I find forty-five there."

name: Genesis 18:29
text: He spoke to him yet again, and said, "What if there are forty found there?" He said, "I will not do it for the forty"s sake."

name: Genesis 18:30
text: He said, "Oh don"t let the Lord be angry, and I will speak. What if there are thirty found there?" He said, "I will not do it, if I find thirty there."

name: Genesis 18:31
text: He said, "See now, I have taken it on myself to speak to the Lord. What if there are twenty found there?" He said, "I will not destroy it for the twenty"s sake."

name: Genesis 18:32
text: He said, "Oh don"t let the Lord be angry, and I will speak just once more. What if ten are found there?" He said, "I will not destroy it for the ten"s sake."

name: Genesis 18:33
text: Yahweh went his way, as soon as he had finished communing with Abraham, and Abraham returned to his place.

name: Genesis 19:1
text: The two angels came to Sodom at evening. Lot sat in the gate of Sodom. Lot saw them, and rose up to meet them. He bowed himself with his face to the earth,

name: Genesis 19:2
text: and he said, "See now, my lords, please turn aside into your servant"s house, stay all night, wash your feet, and you can rise up early, and go on your way." They said, "No, but we will stay in the street all night."

name: Genesis 19:3
text: He urged them greatly, and they came in with him, and entered into his house. He made them a feast, and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.

name: Genesis 19:4
text: But before they lay down, the men of the city, the men of Sodom, surrounded the house, both young and old, all the people from every quarter.

name: Genesis 19:5
text: They called to Lot, and said to him, "Where are the men who came in to you this night? Bring them out to us, that we may have sex with them."

name: Genesis 19:6
text: Lot went out to them to the door, and shut the door after him.

name: Genesis 19:7
text: He said, "Please, my brothers, don"t act so wickedly.

name: Genesis 19:8
text: See now, I have two virgin daughters. Please let me bring them out to you, and you may do to them what seems good to you. Only don"t do anything to these men, because they have come under the shadow of my roof."

name: Genesis 19:9
text: They said, "Stand back!" Then they said, "This one fellow came in to live as a foreigner, and he appoints himself a judge. Now will we deal worse with you, than with them!" They pressed hard on the man Lot, and drew near to break the door.

name: Genesis 19:10
text: But the men reached out their hand, and brought Lot into the house to them, and shut the door.

name: Genesis 19:11
text: They struck the men who were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great, so that they wearied themselves to find the door.

name: Genesis 19:12
text: The men said to Lot, "Do you have anybody else here? Sons-in-law, your sons, your daughters, and whoever you have in the city, bring them out of the place:

name: Genesis 19:13
text: for we will destroy this place, because the outcry against them has grown great before Yahweh that Yahweh has sent us to destroy it."

name: Genesis 19:14
text: Lot went out, and spoke to his sons-in-law, who were pledged to marry his daughters, and said, "Get up! Get out of this place, for Yahweh will destroy the city." But he seemed to his sons-in-law to be joking.

name: Genesis 19:15
text: When the morning came, then the angels hurried Lot, saying, "Get up! Take your wife, and your two daughters who are here, lest you be consumed in the iniquity of the city."

name: Genesis 19:16
text: But he lingered; and the men grabbed his hand, his wife"s hand, and his two daughters" hands, Yahweh being merciful to him; and they took him out, and set him outside of the city.

name: Genesis 19:17
text: It came to pass, when they had taken them out, that he said, "Escape for your life! Don"t look behind you, and don"t stay anywhere in the plain. Escape to the mountains, lest you be consumed!"

name: Genesis 19:18
text: Lot said to them, "Oh, not so, my lord.

name: Genesis 19:19
text: See now, your servant has found favor in your sight, and you have magnified your loving kindness, which you have shown to me in saving my life. I can"t escape to the mountain, lest evil overtake me, and I die.

name: Genesis 19:20
text: See now, this city is near to flee to, and it is a little one. Oh let me escape there (isn"t it a little one?), and my soul will live."

name: Genesis 19:21
text: He said to him, "Behold, I have granted your request concerning this thing also, that I will not overthrow the city of which you have spoken.

name: Genesis 19:22
text: Hurry, escape there, for I can"t do anything until you get there." Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.

name: Genesis 19:23
text: The sun had risen on the earth when Lot came to Zoar.

name: Genesis 19:24
text: Then Yahweh rained on Sodom and on Gomorrah sulfur and fire from Yahweh out of the sky.

name: Genesis 19:25
text: He overthrew those cities, all the plain, all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew on the ground.

name: Genesis 19:26
text: But his wife looked back from behind him, and she became a pillar of salt.

name: Genesis 19:27
text: Abraham got up early in the morning to the place where he had stood before Yahweh.

name: Genesis 19:28
text: He looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and toward all the land of the plain, and looked, and saw that the smoke of the land went up as the smoke of a furnace.

name: Genesis 19:29
text: It happened, when God destroyed the cities of the plain, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the middle of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities in which Lot lived.

name: Genesis 19:30
text: Lot went up out of Zoar, and lived in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he was afraid to live in Zoar. He lived in a cave with his two daughters.

name: Genesis 19:31
text: The firstborn said to the younger, "Our father is old, and there is not a man in the earth to come in to us in the way of all the earth.

name: Genesis 19:32
text: Come, let"s make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, that we may preserve our father"s seed."

name: Genesis 19:33
text: They made their father drink wine that night: and the firstborn went in, and lay with her father. He didn"t know when she lay down, nor when she arose.

name: Genesis 19:34
text: It came to pass on the next day, that the firstborn said to the younger, "Behold, I lay last night with my father. Let us make him drink wine again, tonight. You go in, and lie with him, that we may preserve our father"s seed."

name: Genesis 19:35
text: They made their father drink wine that night also. The younger went and lay with him. He didn"t know when she lay down, nor when she got up.

name: Genesis 19:36
text: Thus both of Lot"s daughters were with child by their father.

name: Genesis 19:37
text: The firstborn bore a son, and named him Moab. He is the father of the Moabites to this day.

name: Genesis 19:38
text: The younger also bore a son, and called his name Ben Ammi. He is the father of the children of Ammon to this day.

name: Genesis 20:1
text: Abraham traveled from there toward the land of the South, and lived between Kadesh and Shur. He lived as a foreigner in Gerar.

name: Genesis 20:2
text: Abraham said about Sarah his wife, "She is my sister." Abimelech king of Gerar sent, and took Sarah.

name: Genesis 20:3
text: But God came to Abimelech in a dream of the night, and said to him, "Behold, you are a dead man, because of the woman whom you have taken. For she is a man"s wife."

name: Genesis 20:4
text: Now Abimelech had not come near her. He said, "Lord, will you kill even a righteous nation?

name: Genesis 20:5
text: Didn"t he tell me, "She is my sister?" She, even she herself, said, "He is my brother." In the integrity of my heart and the innocence of my hands have I done this."

name: Genesis 20:6
text: God said to him in the dream, "Yes, I know that in the integrity of your heart you have done this, and I also withheld you from sinning against me. Therefore I didn"t allow you to touch her.

name: Genesis 20:7
text: Now therefore, restore the man"s wife. For he is a prophet, and he will pray for you, and you will live. If you don"t restore her, know for sure that you will die, you, and all who are yours."

name: Genesis 20:8
text: Abimelech rose early in the morning, and called all his servants, and told all these things in their ear. The men were very scared.

name: Genesis 20:9
text: Then Abimelech called Abraham, and said to him, "What have you done to us? How have I sinned against you, that you have brought on me and on my kingdom a great sin? You have done deeds to me that ought not to be done!"

name: Genesis 20:10
text: Abimelech said to Abraham, "What did you see, that you have done this thing?"

name: Genesis 20:11
text: Abraham said, "Because I thought, "Surely the fear of God is not in this place. They will kill me for my wife"s sake."

name: Genesis 20:12
text: Besides, she is indeed my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife.

name: Genesis 20:13
text: It happened, when God caused me to wander from my father"s house, that I said to her, "This is your kindness which you shall show to me. Everywhere that we go, say of me, "He is my brother."""

name: Genesis 20:14
text: Abimelech took sheep and cattle, male servants and female servants, and gave them to Abraham, and restored Sarah, his wife, to him.

name: Genesis 20:15
text: Abimelech said, "Behold, my land is before you. Dwell where it pleases you."

name: Genesis 20:16
text: To Sarah he said, "Behold, I have given your brother a thousand pieces of silver. Behold, it is for you a covering of the eyes to all that are with you. In front of all you are vindicated."

name: Genesis 20:17
text: Abraham prayed to God. God healed Abimelech, and his wife, and his female servants, and they bore children.

name: Genesis 20:18
text: For Yahweh had closed up tight all the wombs of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah, Abraham"s wife.

name: Genesis 21:1
text: Yahweh visited Sarah as he had said, and Yahweh did to Sarah as he had spoken.

name: Genesis 21:2
text: Sarah conceived, and bore Abraham a son in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to him.

name: Genesis 21:3
text: Abraham called his son who was born to him, whom Sarah bore to him, Isaac.

name: Genesis 21:4
text: Abraham circumcised his son, Isaac, when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him.

name: Genesis 21:5
text: Abraham was one hundred years old when his son, Isaac, was born to him.

name: Genesis 21:6
text: Sarah said, "God has made me laugh. Everyone who hears will laugh with me."

name: Genesis 21:7
text: She said, "Who would have said to Abraham, that Sarah would nurse children? For I have borne him a son in his old age."

name: Genesis 21:8
text: The child grew, and was weaned. Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.

name: Genesis 21:9
text: Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, whom she had borne to Abraham, mocking.

name: Genesis 21:10
text: Therefore she said to Abraham, "Cast out this handmaid and her son! For the son of this handmaid will not be heir with my son, Isaac."

name: Genesis 21:11
text: The thing was very grievous in Abraham"s sight on account of his son.

name: Genesis 21:12
text: God said to Abraham, "Don"t let it be grievous in your sight because of the boy, and because of your handmaid. In all that Sarah says to you, listen to her voice. For from Isaac will your seed be called.

name: Genesis 21:13
text: I will also make a nation of the son of the handmaid, because he is your seed."

name: Genesis 21:14
text: Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread and a bottle of water, and gave it to Hagar, putting it on her shoulder; and gave her the child, and sent her away. She departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.

name: Genesis 21:15
text: The water in the bottle was spent, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs.

name: Genesis 21:16
text: She went and sat down opposite him, a good way off, about a bow shot away. For she said, "Don"t let me see the death of the child." She sat over against him, and lifted up her voice, and wept.

name: Genesis 21:17
text: God heard the voice of the boy. The angel of God called to Hagar out of the sky, and said to her, "What ails you, Hagar? Don"t be afraid. For God has heard the voice of the boy where he is.

name: Genesis 21:18
text: Get up, lift up the boy, and hold him in your hand. For I will make him a great nation."

name: Genesis 21:19
text: God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water. She went, filled the bottle with water, and gave the boy drink.

name: Genesis 21:20
text: God was with the boy, and he grew. He lived in the wilderness, and became, as he grew up, an archer.

name: Genesis 21:21
text: He lived in the wilderness of Paran. His mother took a wife for him out of the land of Egypt.

name: Genesis 21:22
text: It happened at that time, that Abimelech and Phicol the captain of his army spoke to Abraham, saying, "God is with you in all that you do.

name: Genesis 21:23
text: Now, therefore, swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son"s son. But according to the kindness that I have done to you, you shall do to me, and to the land in which you have lived as a foreigner."

name: Genesis 21:24
text: Abraham said, "I will swear."

name: Genesis 21:25
text: Abraham complained to Abimelech because of a water well, which Abimelech"s servants had violently taken away.

name: Genesis 21:26
text: Abimelech said, "I don"t know who has done this thing. You didn"t tell me, neither did I hear of it, until today."

name: Genesis 21:27
text: Abraham took sheep and cattle, and gave them to Abimelech. Those two made a covenant.

name: Genesis 21:28
text: Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.

name: Genesis 21:29
text: Abimelech said to Abraham, "What do these seven ewe lambs which you have set by themselves mean?"

name: Genesis 21:30
text: He said, "You shall take these seven ewe lambs from my hand, that it may be a witness to me, that I have dug this well."

name: Genesis 21:31
text: Therefore he called that place Beersheba, because they both swore there.

name: Genesis 21:32
text: So they made a covenant at Beersheba. Abimelech rose up with Phicol, the captain of his army, and they returned into the land of the Philistines.

name: Genesis 21:33
text: Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba, and called there on the name of Yahweh, the Everlasting God.

name: Genesis 21:34
text: Abraham lived as a foreigner in the land of the Philistines many days.

name: Genesis 22:1
text: It happened after these things, that God tested Abraham, and said to him, "Abraham!" He said, "Here I am."

name: Genesis 22:2
text: He said, "Now take your son, your only son, whom you love, even Isaac, and go into the land of Moriah. Offer him there for a burnt offering on one of the mountains which I will tell you of."

name: Genesis 22:3
text: Abraham rose early in the morning, and saddled his donkey, and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son. He split the wood for the burnt offering, and rose up, and went to the place of which God had told him.

name: Genesis 22:4
text: On the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place far off.

name: Genesis 22:5
