text: Abraham said to his young men, "Stay here with the donkey. The boy and I will go yonder. We will worship, and come back to you."

name: Genesis 22:6
text: Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son. He took in his hand the fire and the knife. They both went together.

name: Genesis 22:7
text: Isaac spoke to Abraham his father, and said, "My father?" He said, "Here I am, my son." He said, "Here is the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?"

name: Genesis 22:8
text: Abraham said, "God will provide himself the lamb for a burnt offering, my son." So they both went together.

name: Genesis 22:9
text: They came to the place which God had told him of. Abraham built the altar there, and laid the wood in order, bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar, on the wood.

name: Genesis 22:10
text: Abraham stretched out his hand, and took the knife to kill his son.

name: Genesis 22:11
text: The angel of Yahweh called to him out of the sky, and said, "Abraham, Abraham!" He said, "Here I am."

name: Genesis 22:12
text: He said, "Don"t lay your hand on the boy, neither do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your only son, from me."

name: Genesis 22:13
text: Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and saw that behind him was a ram caught in the thicket by his horns. Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt offering instead of his son.

name: Genesis 22:14
text: Abraham called the name of that place Yahweh Will Provide. As it is said to this day, "On Yahweh"s mountain, it will be provided."

name: Genesis 22:15
text: The angel of Yahweh called to Abraham a second time out of the sky,

name: Genesis 22:16
text: and said, "I have sworn by myself, says Yahweh, because you have done this thing, and have not withheld your son, your only son,

name: Genesis 22:17
text: that I will bless you greatly, and I will multiply your seed greatly like the stars of the heavens, and like the sand which is on the seashore. Your seed will possess the gate of his enemies.

name: Genesis 22:18
text: In your seed will all the nations of the earth be blessed, because you have obeyed my voice."

name: Genesis 22:19
text: So Abraham returned to his young men, and they rose up and went together to Beersheba. Abraham lived at Beersheba.

name: Genesis 22:20
text: It happened after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying, "Behold, Milcah, she also has borne children to your brother Nahor:

name: Genesis 22:21
text: Uz his firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel the father of Aram,

name: Genesis 22:22
text: Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel."

name: Genesis 22:23
text: Bethuel became the father of Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham"s brother.

name: Genesis 22:24
text: His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.

name: Genesis 23:1
text: Sarah lived one hundred twenty-seven years. This was the length of Sarah"s life.

name: Genesis 23:2
text: Sarah died in Kiriath Arba (the same is Hebron), in the land of Canaan. Abraham came to mourn for Sarah, and to weep for her.

name: Genesis 23:3
text: Abraham rose up from before his dead, and spoke to the children of Heth, saying,

name: Genesis 23:4
text: "I am a stranger and a foreigner living with you. Give me a possession of a burying-place with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight."

name: Genesis 23:5
text: The children of Heth answered Abraham, saying to him,

name: Genesis 23:6
text: "Hear us, my lord. You are a prince of God among us. Bury your dead in the best of our tombs. None of us will withhold from you his tomb. Bury your dead."

name: Genesis 23:7
text: Abraham rose up, and bowed himself to the people of the land, even to the children of Heth.

name: Genesis 23:8
text: He talked with them, saying, "If it be your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight, hear me, and entreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar,

name: Genesis 23:9
text: that he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he has, which is in the end of his field. For the full price let him give it to me among you for a possession of a burying-place."

name: Genesis 23:10
text: Now Ephron was sitting in the middle of the children of Heth. Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the children of Heth, even of all who went in at the gate of his city, saying,

name: Genesis 23:11
text: "No, my lord, hear me. I give you the field, and I give you the cave that is in it. In the presence of the children of my people I give it to you. Bury your dead."

name: Genesis 23:12
text: Abraham bowed himself down before the people of the land.

name: Genesis 23:13
text: He spoke to Ephron in the audience of the people of the land, saying, "But if you will, please hear me. I will give the price of the field. Take it from me, and I will bury my dead there."

name: Genesis 23:14
text: Ephron answered Abraham, saying to him,

name: Genesis 23:15
text: "My lord, listen to me. What is a piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver between me and you? Therefore bury your dead."

name: Genesis 23:16
text: Abraham listened to Ephron. Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver which he had named in the audience of the children of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, according to the current merchants" standard.

name: Genesis 23:17
text: So the field of Ephron, which was in Machpelah, which was before Mamre, the field, the cave which was in it, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all of its borders, were deeded

name: Genesis 23:18
text: to Abraham for a possession in the presence of the children of Heth, before all who went in at the gate of his city.

name: Genesis 23:19
text: After this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre (that is, Hebron), in the land of Canaan.

name: Genesis 23:20
text: The field, and the cave that is in it, were deeded to Abraham for a possession of a burying place by the children of Heth.

name: Genesis 24:1
text: Abraham was old, and well stricken in age. Yahweh had blessed Abraham in all things.

name: Genesis 24:2
text: Abraham said to his servant, the elder of his house, who ruled over all that he had, "Please put your hand under my thigh.

name: Genesis 24:3
text: I will make you swear by Yahweh, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you shall not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I live.

name: Genesis 24:4
text: But you shall go to my country, and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son Isaac."

name: Genesis 24:5
text: The servant said to him, "What if the woman isn"t willing to follow me to this land? Must I bring your son again to the land you came from?"

name: Genesis 24:6
text: Abraham said to him, "Beware that you don"t bring my son there again.

name: Genesis 24:7
text: Yahweh, the God of heaven, who took me from my father"s house, and from the land of my birth, who spoke to me, and who swore to me, saying, "I will give this land to your seed." He will send his angel before you, and you shall take a wife for my son from there.

name: Genesis 24:8
text: If the woman isn"t willing to follow you, then you shall be clear from this my oath. Only you shall not bring my son there again."

name: Genesis 24:9
text: The servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and swore to him concerning this matter.

name: Genesis 24:10
text: The servant took ten camels, of his master"s camels, and departed, having a variety of good things of his master"s with him. He arose, and went to Mesopotamia, to the city of Nahor.

name: Genesis 24:11
text: He made the camels kneel down outside the city by the well of water at the time of evening, the time that women go out to draw water.

name: Genesis 24:12
text: He said, "Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, please give me success this day, and show kindness to my master Abraham.

name: Genesis 24:13
text: Behold, I am standing by the spring of water. The daughters of the men of the city are coming out to draw water.

name: Genesis 24:14
text: Let it happen, that the young lady to whom I will say, "Please let down your pitcher, that I may drink," and she will say, "Drink, and I will also give your camels a drink,""let her be the one you have appointed for your servant Isaac. By this I will know that you have shown kindness to my master."

name: Genesis 24:15
text: It happened, before he had finished speaking, that behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham"s brother, with her pitcher on her shoulder.

name: Genesis 24:16
text: The young lady was very beautiful to look at, a virgin, neither had any man known her. She went down to the spring, filled her pitcher, and came up.

name: Genesis 24:17
text: The servant ran to meet her, and said, "Please give me a drink, a little water from your pitcher."

name: Genesis 24:18
text: She said, "Drink, my lord." She hurried, and let down her pitcher on her hand, and gave him drink.

name: Genesis 24:19
text: When she had done giving him drink, she said, "I will also draw for your camels, until they have done drinking."

name: Genesis 24:20
text: She hurried, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again to the well to draw, and drew for all his camels.

name: Genesis 24:21
text: The man looked steadfastly at her, remaining silent, to know whether Yahweh had made his journey prosperous or not.

name: Genesis 24:22
text: It happened, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden ring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold,

name: Genesis 24:23
text: and said, "Whose daughter are you? Please tell me. Is there room in your father"s house for us to lodge in?"

name: Genesis 24:24
text: She said to him, "I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor."

name: Genesis 24:25
text: She said moreover to him, "We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in."

name: Genesis 24:26
text: The man bowed his head, and worshiped Yahweh.

name: Genesis 24:27
text: He said, "Blessed be Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, who has not forsaken his loving kindness and his truth toward my master. As for me, Yahweh has led me in the way to the house of my master"s relatives."

name: Genesis 24:28
text: The young lady ran, and told her mother"s house about these words.

name: Genesis 24:29
text: Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban. Laban ran out to the man, to the spring.

name: Genesis 24:30
text: It happened, when he saw the ring, and the bracelets on his sister"s hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, "This is what the man said to me," that he came to the man. Behold, he was standing by the camels at the spring.

name: Genesis 24:31
text: He said, "Come in, you blessed of Yahweh. Why do you stand outside? For I have prepared the house, and room for the camels."

name: Genesis 24:32
text: The man came into the house, and he unloaded the camels. He gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of the men who were with him.

name: Genesis 24:33
text: Food was set before him to eat, but he said, "I will not eat until I have told my message." He said, "Speak on."

name: Genesis 24:34
text: He said, "I am Abraham"s servant.

name: Genesis 24:35
text: Yahweh has blessed my master greatly. He has become great. He has given him flocks and herds, silver and gold, male servants and female servants, and camels and donkeys.

name: Genesis 24:36
text: Sarah, my master"s wife, bore a son to my master when she was old. He has given all that he has to him.

name: Genesis 24:37
text: My master made me swear, saying, "You shall not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I live,

name: Genesis 24:38
text: but you shall go to my father"s house, and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son."

name: Genesis 24:39
text: I asked my master, "What if the woman will not follow me?"

name: Genesis 24:40
text: He said to me, "Yahweh, before whom I walk, will send his angel with you, and prosper your way. You shall take a wife for my son of my relatives, and of my father"s house.

name: Genesis 24:41
text: Then will you be clear from my oath, when you come to my relatives. If they don"t give her to you, you shall be clear from my oath."

name: Genesis 24:42
text: I came this day to the spring, and said, "Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, if now you do prosper my way which I go"

name: Genesis 24:43
text: behold, I am standing by this spring of water. Let it happen, that the maiden who comes out to draw, to whom I will say, "Please give me a little water from your pitcher to drink,"

name: Genesis 24:44
text: and she will tell me, "Drink, and I will also draw for your camels,""let her be the woman whom Yahweh has appointed for my master"s son."

name: Genesis 24:45
text: Before I had finished speaking in my heart, behold, Rebekah came out with her pitcher on her shoulder. She went down to the spring, and drew. I said to her, "Please let me drink."

name: Genesis 24:46
text: She hurried and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, "Drink, and I will also give your camels a drink." So I drank, and she also gave the camels a drink.

name: Genesis 24:47
text: I asked her, and said, "Whose daughter are you?" She said, "The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor"s son, whom Milcah bore to him." I put the ring on her nose, and the bracelets on her hands.

name: Genesis 24:48
text: I bowed my head, and worshiped Yahweh, and blessed Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, who had led me in the right way to take my master"s brother"s daughter for his son.

name: Genesis 24:49
text: Now if you will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me. If not, tell me, that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left."

name: Genesis 24:50
text: Then Laban and Bethuel answered, "The thing proceeds from Yahweh. We can"t speak to you bad or good.

name: Genesis 24:51
text: Behold, Rebekah is before you. Take her, and go, and let her be your master"s son"s wife, as Yahweh has spoken."

name: Genesis 24:52
text: It happened that when Abraham"s servant heard their words, he bowed himself down to the earth to Yahweh.

name: Genesis 24:53
text: The servant brought out jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and clothing, and gave them to Rebekah. He also gave precious things to her brother and her mother.

name: Genesis 24:54
text: They ate and drank, he and the men who were with him, and stayed all night. They rose up in the morning, and he said, "Send me away to my master."

name: Genesis 24:55
text: Her brother and her mother said, "Let the young lady stay with us a few days, at least ten. After that she will go."

name: Genesis 24:56
text: He said to them, "Don"t hinder me, since Yahweh has prospered my way. Send me away that I may go to my master."

name: Genesis 24:57
text: They said, "We will call the young lady, and ask her."

name: Genesis 24:58
text: They called Rebekah, and said to her, "Will you go with this man?" She said, "I will go."

name: Genesis 24:59
text: They sent away Rebekah, their sister, with her nurse, Abraham"s servant, and his men.

name: Genesis 24:60
text: They blessed Rebekah, and said to her, "Our sister, may you be the mother of thousands of ten thousands, and let your seed possess the gate of those who hate them."

name: Genesis 24:61
text: Rebekah arose with her ladies. They rode on the camels, and followed the man. The servant took Rebekah, and went his way.

name: Genesis 24:62
text: Isaac came from the way of Beer Lahai Roi, for he lived in the land of the South.

name: Genesis 24:63
text: Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the evening. He lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, there were camels coming.

name: Genesis 24:64
text: Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she dismounted from the camel.

name: Genesis 24:65
text: She said to the servant, "Who is the man who is walking in the field to meet us?" The servant said, "It is my master." She took her veil, and covered herself.

name: Genesis 24:66
text: The servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.

name: Genesis 24:67
text: Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah"s tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife. He loved her. Isaac was comforted after his mother"s death.

name: Genesis 25:1
text: Abraham took another wife, and her name was Keturah.

name: Genesis 25:2
text: She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.

name: Genesis 25:3
text: Jokshan became the father of Sheba, and Dedan. The sons of Dedan were Asshurim, Letushim, and Leummim.

name: Genesis 25:4
text: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.

name: Genesis 25:5
text: Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac,

name: Genesis 25:6
text: but to the sons of Abraham"s concubines, Abraham gave gifts. He sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, to the east country.

name: Genesis 25:7
text: These are the days of the years of Abraham"s life which he lived: one hundred seventy-five years.

name: Genesis 25:8
text: Abraham gave up the spirit, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years, and was gathered to his people.

name: Genesis 25:9
text: Isaac and Ishmael, his sons, buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron, the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre,

name: Genesis 25:10
text: the field which Abraham purchased of the children of Heth. Abraham was buried there with Sarah, his wife.

name: Genesis 25:11
text: It happened after the death of Abraham that God blessed Isaac, his son. Isaac lived by Beer Lahai Roi.

name: Genesis 25:12
text: Now this is the history of the generations of Ishmael, Abraham"s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah"s handmaid, bore to Abraham.

name: Genesis 25:13
text: These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to the order of their birth: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

name: Genesis 25:14
text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,

name: Genesis 25:15
text: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah.

name: Genesis 25:16
text: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their villages, and by their encampments: twelve princes, according to their nations.

name: Genesis 25:17
text: These are the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred thirty-seven years. He gave up the spirit and died, and was gathered to his people.

name: Genesis 25:18
text: They lived from Havilah to Shur that is before Egypt, as you go toward Assyria. He lived opposite all his relatives.

name: Genesis 25:19
text: This is the history of the generations of Isaac, Abraham"s son. Abraham became the father of Isaac.

name: Genesis 25:20
text: Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Paddan Aram, the sister of Laban the Syrian, to be his wife.

name: Genesis 25:21
text: Isaac entreated Yahweh for his wife, because she was barren. Yahweh was entreated by him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.

name: Genesis 25:22
text: The children struggled together within her. She said, "If it be so, why do I live?" She went to inquire of Yahweh.

name: Genesis 25:23
text: Yahweh said to her, "Two nations are in your womb. Two peoples will be separated from your body. The one people will be stronger than the other people. The elder will serve the younger."

name: Genesis 25:24
text: When her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.

name: Genesis 25:25
text: The first came out red all over, like a hairy garment. They named him Esau.

name: Genesis 25:26
text: After that, his brother came out, and his hand had hold on Esau"s heel. He was named Jacob. Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them.

name: Genesis 25:27
text: The boys grew. Esau was a skillful hunter, a man of the field. Jacob was a quiet man, living in tents.

name: Genesis 25:28
text: Now Isaac loved Esau, because he ate his venison. Rebekah loved Jacob.

name: Genesis 25:29
text: Jacob boiled stew. Esau came in from the field, and he was famished.

name: Genesis 25:30
text: Esau said to Jacob, "Please feed me with that same red stew, for I am famished." Therefore his name was called Edom.

name: Genesis 25:31
text: Jacob said, "First, sell me your birthright."

name: Genesis 25:32
text: Esau said, "Behold, I am about to die. What good is the birthright to me?"

name: Genesis 25:33
text: Jacob said, "Swear to me first." He swore to him. He sold his birthright to Jacob.

name: Genesis 25:34
text: Jacob gave Esau bread and stew of lentils. He ate and drank, rose up, and went his way. So Esau despised his birthright.

name: Genesis 26:1
text: There was a famine in the land, besides the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. Isaac went to Abimelech king of the Philistines, to Gerar.

name: Genesis 26:2
text: Yahweh appeared to him, and said, "Don"t go down into Egypt. Live in the land I will tell you about.

name: Genesis 26:3
text: Live in this land, and I will be with you, and will bless you. For to you, and to your seed, I will give all these lands, and I will establish the oath which I swore to Abraham your father.

name: Genesis 26:4
text: I will multiply your seed as the stars of the sky, and will give to your seed all these lands. In your seed will all the nations of the earth be blessed,

name: Genesis 26:5
text: because Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my requirements, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws."

name: Genesis 26:6
text: Isaac lived in Gerar.

name: Genesis 26:7
text: The men of the place asked him about his wife. He said, "She is my sister," for he was afraid to say, "My wife," lest, he thought, "the men of the place might kill me for Rebekah, because she is beautiful to look at."

name: Genesis 26:8
text: It happened, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was caressing Rebekah, his wife.

name: Genesis 26:9
text: Abimelech called Isaac, and said, "Behold, surely she is your wife. Why did you say, "She is my sister?"" Isaac said to him, "Because I said, "Lest I die because of her.""

name: Genesis 26:10
text: Abimelech said, "What is this you have done to us? One of the people might easily have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt on us!"

name: Genesis 26:11
text: Abimelech commanded all the people, saying, "He who touches this man or his wife will surely be put to death."

name: Genesis 26:12
text: Isaac sowed in that land, and reaped in the same year one hundred times what he planted. Yahweh blessed him.

name: Genesis 26:13
text: The man grew great, and grew more and more until he became very great.

name: Genesis 26:14
text: He had possessions of flocks, possessions of herds, and a great household. The Philistines envied him.

name: Genesis 26:15
text: Now all the wells which his father"s servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped, and filled with earth.

name: Genesis 26:16
text: Abimelech said to Isaac, "Go from us, for you are much mightier than we."

name: Genesis 26:17
text: Isaac departed from there, encamped in the valley of Gerar, and lived there.

name: Genesis 26:18
text: Isaac dug again the wells of water, which they had dug in the days of Abraham his father. For the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham. He called their names after the names by which his father had called them.

name: Genesis 26:19
text: Isaac"s servants dug in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.

name: Genesis 26:20
text: The herdsmen of Gerar argued with Isaac"s herdsmen, saying, "The water is ours." He called the name of the well Esek, because they contended with him.

name: Genesis 26:21
text: They dug another well, and they argued over that, also. He called its name Sitnah.

name: Genesis 26:22
text: He left that place, and dug another well. They didn"t argue over that one. He called it Rehoboth. He said, "For now Yahweh has made room for us, and we will be fruitful in the land."

name: Genesis 26:23
text: He went up from there to Beersheba.

name: Genesis 26:24
text: Yahweh appeared to him the same night, and said, "I am the God of Abraham your father. Don"t be afraid, for I am with you, and will bless you, and multiply your seed for my servant Abraham"s sake."

name: Genesis 26:25
text: He built an altar there, and called on the name of Yahweh, and pitched his tent there. There Isaac"s servants dug a well.

name: Genesis 26:26
text: Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath his friend, and Phicol the captain of his army.

name: Genesis 26:27
text: Isaac said to them, "Why have you come to me, since you hate me, and have sent me away from you?"

name: Genesis 26:28
text: They said, "We saw plainly that Yahweh was with you. We said, "Let there now be an oath between us, even between us and you, and let us make a covenant with you,

name: Genesis 26:29
text: that you will do us no harm, as we have not touched you, and as we have done to you nothing but good, and have sent you away in peace." You are now the blessed of Yahweh."

name: Genesis 26:30
text: He made them a feast, and they ate and drank.

name: Genesis 26:31
text: They rose up some time in the morning, and swore one to another. Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.

name: Genesis 26:32
text: It happened the same day, that Isaac"s servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had dug, and said to him, "We have found water."

name: Genesis 26:33
text: He called it Shibah. Therefore the name of the city is Beersheba to this day.

name: Genesis 26:34
text: When Esau was forty years old, he took as wife Judith, the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath, the daughter of Elon the Hittite.

name: Genesis 26:35
text: They grieved Isaac"s and Rebekah"s spirits.

name: Genesis 27:1
text: It happened, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his elder son, and said to him, "My son?" He said to him, "Here I am."

name: Genesis 27:2
text: He said, "See now, I am old. I don"t know the day of my death.

name: Genesis 27:3
text: Now therefore, please take your weapons, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field, and take me venison.

name: Genesis 27:4
text: Make me savory food, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat, and that my soul may bless you before I die."

name: Genesis 27:5
text: Rebekah heard when Isaac spoke to Esau his son. Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.

name: Genesis 27:6
text: Rebekah spoke to Jacob her son, saying, "Behold, I heard your father speak to Esau your brother, saying,

name: Genesis 27:7
text: "Bring me venison, and make me savory food, that I may eat, and bless you before Yahweh before my death."

name: Genesis 27:8
text: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command you.

name: Genesis 27:9
text: Go now to the flock, and get me from there two good young goats. I will make them savory food for your father, such as he loves.

name: Genesis 27:10
text: You shall bring it to your father, that he may eat, so that he may bless you before his death."

name: Genesis 27:11
text: Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, "Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man.

name: Genesis 27:12
text: What if my father touches me? I will seem to him as a deceiver, and I would bring a curse on myself, and not a blessing."

name: Genesis 27:13
text: His mother said to him, "Let your curse be on me, my son. Only obey my voice, and go get them for me."

name: Genesis 27:14
text: He went, and got them, and brought them to his mother. His mother made savory food, such as his father loved.

name: Genesis 27:15
text: Rebekah took the good clothes of Esau, her elder son, which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob, her younger son.

name: Genesis 27:16
text: She put the skins of the young goats on his hands, and on the smooth of his neck.

name: Genesis 27:17
text: She gave the savory food and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.

name: Genesis 27:18
text: He came to his father, and said, "My father?" He said, "Here I am. Who are you, my son?"

name: Genesis 27:19
text: Jacob said to his father, "I am Esau your firstborn. I have done what you asked me to do. Please arise, sit and eat of my venison, that your soul may bless me."

name: Genesis 27:20
text: Isaac said to his son, "How is it that you have found it so quickly, my son?" He said, "Because Yahweh your God gave me success."

name: Genesis 27:21
text: Isaac said to Jacob, "Please come near, that I may feel you, my son, whether you are really my son Esau or not."

name: Genesis 27:22
text: Jacob went near to Isaac his father. He felt him, and said, "The voice is Jacob"s voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau."

name: Genesis 27:23
text: He didn"t recognize him, because his hands were hairy, like his brother, Esau"s hands. So he blessed him.

name: Genesis 27:24
text: He said, "Are you really my son Esau?" He said, "I am."

name: Genesis 27:25
text: He said, "Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son"s venison, that my soul may bless you." He brought it near to him, and he ate. He brought him wine, and he drank.

name: Genesis 27:26
text: His father Isaac said to him, "Come near now, and kiss me, my son."

name: Genesis 27:27
text: He came near, and kissed him. He smelled the smell of his clothing, and blessed him, and said, "Behold, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which Yahweh has blessed.

name: Genesis 27:28
text: God give you of the dew of the sky, of the fatness of the earth, and plenty of grain and new wine.

name: Genesis 27:29
text: Let peoples serve you, and nations bow down to you. Be lord over your brothers. Let your mother"s sons bow down to you. Cursed be everyone who curses you. Blessed be everyone who blesses you."

name: Genesis 27:30
text: It happened, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob had just gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.

name: Genesis 27:31
text: He also made savory food, and brought it to his father. He said to his father, "Let my father arise, and eat of his son"s venison, that your soul may bless me."

name: Genesis 27:32
text: Isaac his father said to him, "Who are you?" He said, "I am your son, your firstborn, Esau."

name: Genesis 27:33
text: Isaac trembled violently, and said, "Who, then, is he who has taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before you came, and have blessed him? Yes, he will be blessed."

name: Genesis 27:34
text: When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with an exceeding great and bitter cry, and said to his father, "Bless me, even me also, my father."

name: Genesis 27:35
text: He said, "Your brother came with deceit, and has taken away your blessing."

name: Genesis 27:36
text: He said, "Isn"t he rightly named Jacob? For he has supplanted me these two times. He took away my birthright. See, now he has taken away my blessing." He said, "Haven"t you reserved a blessing for me?"

name: Genesis 27:37
text: Isaac answered Esau, "Behold, I have made him your lord, and all his brothers have I given to him for servants. With grain and new wine have I sustained him. What then will I do for you, my son?"

name: Genesis 27:38
text: Esau said to his father, "Have you but one blessing, my father? Bless me, even me also, my father." Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.

name: Genesis 27:39
text: Isaac his father answered him, "Behold, of the fatness of the earth will be your dwelling, and of the dew of the sky from above.

name: Genesis 27:40
text: By your sword will you live, and you will serve your brother. It will happen, when you will break loose, that you shall shake his yoke from off your neck."

name: Genesis 27:41
text: Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing with which his father blessed him. Esau said in his heart, "The days of mourning for my father are at hand. Then I will kill my brother Jacob."

name: Genesis 27:42
text: The words of Esau, her elder son, were told to Rebekah. She sent and called Jacob, her younger son, and said to him, "Behold, your brother Esau comforts himself about you by planning to kill you.

name: Genesis 27:43
text: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice. Arise, flee to Laban, my brother, in Haran.

name: Genesis 27:44
text: Stay with him a few days, until your brother"s fury turns away;

name: Genesis 27:45
text: until your brother"s anger turn away from you, and he forgets what you have done to him. Then I will send, and get you from there. Why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?"

name: Genesis 27:46
text: Rebekah said to Isaac, "I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth. If Jacob takes a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these, of the daughters of the land, what good will my life do me?"

name: Genesis 28:1
text: Isaac called Jacob, blessed him, and commanded him, "You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.

name: Genesis 28:2
text: Arise, go to Paddan Aram, to the house of Bethuel your mother"s father. Take a wife from there from the daughters of Laban, your mother"s brother.

name: Genesis 28:3
text: May God Almighty bless you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, that you may be a company of peoples,

name: Genesis 28:4
text: and give you the blessing of Abraham, to you, and to your seed with you, that you may inherit the land where you travel, which God gave to Abraham."

name: Genesis 28:5
text: Isaac sent Jacob away. He went to Paddan Aram to Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, Rebekah"s brother, Jacob"s and Esau"s mother.

name: Genesis 28:6
text: Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Paddan Aram, to take him a wife from there, and that as he blessed him he gave him a command, saying, "You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan,"

name: Genesis 28:7
text: and that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Paddan Aram.

name: Genesis 28:8
text: Esau saw that the daughters of Canaan didn"t please Isaac, his father.

name: Genesis 28:9
text: Esau went to Ishmael, and took, besides the wives that he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham"s son, the sister of Nebaioth, to be his wife.

name: Genesis 28:10
text: Jacob went out from Beersheba, and went toward Haran.

name: Genesis 28:11
text: He came to a certain place, and stayed there all night, because the sun had set. He took one of the stones of the place, and put it under his head, and lay down in that place to sleep.

name: Genesis 28:12
text: He dreamed. Behold, a stairway set upon the earth, and its top reached to heaven. Behold, the angels of God ascending and descending on it.

name: Genesis 28:13
text: Behold, Yahweh stood above it, and said, "I am Yahweh, the God of Abraham your father, and the God of Isaac. The land whereon you lie, to you will I give it, and to your seed.

name: Genesis 28:14
text: Your seed will be as the dust of the earth, and you will spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south. In you and in your seed will all the families of the earth be blessed.

name: Genesis 28:15
text: Behold, I am with you, and will keep you, wherever you go, and will bring you again into this land. For I will not leave you, until I have done that which I have spoken of to you."

name: Genesis 28:16
text: Jacob awakened out of his sleep, and he said, "Surely Yahweh is in this place, and I didn"t know it."

name: Genesis 28:17
text: He was afraid, and said, "How dreadful is this place! This is none other than God"s house, and this is the gate of heaven."

name: Genesis 28:18
text: Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put under his head, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil on its top.

name: Genesis 28:19
text: He called the name of that place Bethel, but the name of the city was Luz at the first.

name: Genesis 28:20
text: Jacob vowed a vow, saying, "If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and clothing to put on,

name: Genesis 28:21
text: so that I come again to my father"s house in peace, and Yahweh will be my God,

name: Genesis 28:22
text: then this stone, which I have set up for a pillar, will be God"s house. Of all that you will give me I will surely give the tenth to you."

name: Genesis 29:1
text: Then Jacob went on his journey, and came to the land of the children of the east.

name: Genesis 29:2
text: He looked, and behold, a well in the field, and, behold, three flocks of sheep lying there by it. For out of that well they watered the flocks. The stone on the well"s mouth was large.

name: Genesis 29:3
text: There all the flocks were gathered. They rolled the stone from the well"s mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again on the well"s mouth in its place.

name: Genesis 29:4
text: Jacob said to them, "My relatives, where are you from?" They said, "We are from Haran."

name: Genesis 29:5
text: He said to them, "Do you know Laban, the son of Nahor?" They said, "We know him."

name: Genesis 29:6
text: He said to them, "Is it well with him?" They said, "It is well. See, Rachel, his daughter, is coming with the sheep."

name: Genesis 29:7
text: He said, "Behold, it is still the middle of the day, not time to gather the livestock together. Water the sheep, and go and feed them."

name: Genesis 29:8
text: They said, "We can"t, until all the flocks are gathered together, and they roll the stone from the well"s mouth. Then we water the sheep."

name: Genesis 29:9
text: While he was yet speaking with them, Rachel came with her father"s sheep, for she kept them.

name: Genesis 29:10
text: It happened, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban, his mother"s brother, and the sheep of Laban, his mother"s brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well"s mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother"s brother.

name: Genesis 29:11
text: Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.

name: Genesis 29:12
text: Jacob told Rachel that he was her father"s brother, and that he was Rebekah"s son. She ran and told her father.

name: Genesis 29:13
text: It happened, when Laban heard the news of Jacob, his sister"s son, that he ran to meet Jacob, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. Jacob told Laban all these things.

name: Genesis 29:14
text: Laban said to him, "Surely you are my bone and my flesh." He lived with him for a month.

name: Genesis 29:15
text: Laban said to Jacob, "Because you are my brother, should you therefore serve me for nothing? Tell me, what will your wages be?"

name: Genesis 29:16
text: Laban had two daughters. The name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.

name: Genesis 29:17
text: Leah"s eyes were weak, but Rachel was beautiful in form and attractive.

name: Genesis 29:18
text: Jacob loved Rachel. He said, "I will serve you seven years for Rachel, your younger daughter."

name: Genesis 29:19
text: Laban said, "It is better that I give her to you, than that I should give her to another man. Stay with me."

name: Genesis 29:20
text: Jacob served seven years for Rachel. They seemed to him but a few days, for the love he had for her.

name: Genesis 29:21
text: Jacob said to Laban, "Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in to her."

name: Genesis 29:22
text: Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.

name: Genesis 29:23
text: It happened in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him. He went in to her.

name: Genesis 29:24
text: Laban gave Zilpah his handmaid to his daughter Leah for a handmaid.

name: Genesis 29:25
text: It happened in the morning that, behold, it was Leah. He said to Laban, "What is this you have done to me? Didn"t I serve with you for Rachel? Why then have you deceived me?"

name: Genesis 29:26
text: Laban said, "It is not done so in our place, to give the younger before the firstborn.

name: Genesis 29:27
text: Fulfill the week of this one, and we will give you the other also for the service which you will serve with me yet seven other years."

name: Genesis 29:28
text: Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week. He gave him Rachel his daughter as wife.

name: Genesis 29:29
text: Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah, his handmaid, to be her handmaid.

name: Genesis 29:30
text: He went in also to Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served with him yet seven other years.

name: Genesis 29:31
text: Yahweh saw that Leah was hated, and he opened her womb, but Rachel was barren.

name: Genesis 29:32
text: Leah conceived, and bore a son, and she named him Reuben. For she said, "Because Yahweh has looked at my affliction. For now my husband will love me."

name: Genesis 29:33
text: She conceived again, and bore a son, and said, "Because Yahweh has heard that I am hated, he has therefore given me this son also." She named him Simeon.

name: Genesis 29:34
text: She conceived again, and bore a son. Said, "Now this time will my husband be joined to me, because I have borne him three sons." Therefore was his name called Levi.

name: Genesis 29:35
text: She conceived again, and bore a son. She said, "This time will I praise Yahweh." Therefore she named him Judah. Then she stopped bearing.

name: Genesis 30:1
text: When Rachel saw that she bore Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister. She said to Jacob, "Give me children, or else I will die."

name: Genesis 30:2
text: Jacob"s anger was kindled against Rachel, and he said, "Am I in God"s place, who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb?"

name: Genesis 30:3
text: She said, "Behold, my maid Bilhah. Go in to her, that she may bear on my knees, and I also may obtain children by her."

name: Genesis 30:4
text: She gave him Bilhah her handmaid as wife, and Jacob went in to her.

name: Genesis 30:5
text: Bilhah conceived, and bore Jacob a son.

name: Genesis 30:6
text: Rachel said, "God has judged me, and has also heard my voice, and has given me a son." Therefore called she his name Dan.

name: Genesis 30:7
text: Bilhah, Rachel"s handmaid, conceived again, and bore Jacob a second son.

name: Genesis 30:8
text: Rachel said, "With mighty wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and have prevailed." She named him Naphtali.

name: Genesis 30:9
text: When Leah saw that she had finished bearing, she took Zilpah, her handmaid, and gave her to Jacob as a wife.

name: Genesis 30:10
text: Zilpah, Leah"s handmaid, bore Jacob a son.

name: Genesis 30:11
text: Leah said, "How fortunate!" She named him Gad.

name: Genesis 30:12
text: Zilpah, Leah"s handmaid, bore Jacob a second son.

name: Genesis 30:13
text: Leah said, "Happy am I, for the daughters will call me happy." She named him Asher.

name: Genesis 30:14
text: Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them to his mother, Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, "Please give me some of your son"s mandrakes."

name: Genesis 30:15
text: She said to her, "Is it a small matter that you have taken away my husband? Would you take away my son"s mandrakes, also?" Rachel said, "Therefore he will lie with you tonight for your son"s mandrakes."

name: Genesis 30:16
text: Jacob came from the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, "You must come in to me; for I have surely hired you with my son"s mandrakes." He lay with her that night.

name: Genesis 30:17
text: God listened to Leah, and she conceived, and bore Jacob a fifth son.

name: Genesis 30:18
text: Leah said, "God has given me my hire, because I gave my handmaid to my husband." She named him Issachar.

name: Genesis 30:19
text: Leah conceived again, and bore a sixth son to Jacob.

name: Genesis 30:20
text: Leah said, "God has endowed me with a good dowry. Now my husband will live with me, because I have borne him six sons." She named him Zebulun.

name: Genesis 30:21
text: Afterwards, she bore a daughter, and named her Dinah.

name: Genesis 30:22
text: God remembered Rachel, and God listened to her, and opened her womb.

name: Genesis 30:23
text: She conceived, bore a son, and said, "God has taken away my reproach."

name: Genesis 30:24
text: She named him Joseph, saying, "May Yahweh add another son to me."

name: Genesis 30:25
text: It happened, when Rachel had borne Joseph, that Jacob said to Laban, "Send me away, that I may go to my own place, and to my country.

name: Genesis 30:26
text: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, and let me go; for you know my service with which I have served you."

name: Genesis 30:27
text: Laban said to him, "If now I have found favor in your eyes, stay here, for I have divined that Yahweh has blessed me for your sake."

name: Genesis 30:28
text: He said, "Appoint me your wages, and I will give it."

name: Genesis 30:29
text: He said to him, "You know how I have served you, and how your livestock have fared with me.

name: Genesis 30:30
text: For it was little which you had before I came, and it has increased to a multitude. Yahweh has blessed you wherever I turned. Now when will I provide for my own house also?"

name: Genesis 30:31
text: He said, "What shall I give you?" Jacob said, "You shall not give me anything. If you will do this thing for me, I will again feed your flock and keep it.

name: Genesis 30:32
text: I will pass through all your flock today, removing from there every speckled and spotted one, and every black one among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats. This will be my hire.

name: Genesis 30:33
text: So my righteousness will answer for me hereafter, when you come concerning my hire that is before you. Every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and black among the sheep, that might be with me, will be counted stolen."

name: Genesis 30:34
text: Laban said, "Behold, let it be according to your word."

name: Genesis 30:35
text: That day, he removed the male goats that were streaked and spotted, and all the female goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had white in it, and all the black ones among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his sons.

name: Genesis 30:36
text: He set three days" journey between himself and Jacob, and Jacob fed the rest of Laban"s flocks.

name: Genesis 30:37
text: Jacob took to himself rods of fresh poplar, almond, plane tree, peeled white streaks in them, and made the white appear which was in the rods.

name: Genesis 30:38
text: He set the rods which he had peeled opposite the flocks in the gutters in the watering-troughs where the flocks came to drink. They conceived when they came to drink.

name: Genesis 30:39
text: The flocks conceived before the rods, and the flocks produced streaked, speckled, and spotted.

name: Genesis 30:40
text: Jacob separated the lambs, and set the faces of the flocks toward the streaked and all the black in the flock of Laban: and he put his own droves apart, and didn"t put them into Laban"s flock.

name: Genesis 30:41
text: It happened, whenever the stronger of the flock conceived, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the flock in the gutters, that they might conceive among the rods;

name: Genesis 30:42
text: but when the flock were feeble, he didn"t put them in. So the feebler were Laban"s, and the stronger Jacob"s.

name: Genesis 30:43
text: The man increased exceedingly, and had large flocks, female servants and male servants, and camels and donkeys.

name: Genesis 31:1
text: He heard the words of Laban"s sons, saying, "Jacob has taken away all that was our father"s. From that which was our father"s, has he gotten all this wealth."

name: Genesis 31:2
text: Jacob saw the expression on Laban"s face, and, behold, it was not toward him as before.

name: Genesis 31:3
text: Yahweh said to Jacob, "Return to the land of your fathers, and to your relatives, and I will be with you."

name: Genesis 31:4
text: Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field to his flock,

name: Genesis 31:5
text: and said to them, "I see the expression on your father"s face, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me.

name: Genesis 31:6
text: You know that I have served your father with all of my strength.

name: Genesis 31:7
text: Your father has deceived me, and changed my wages ten times, but God didn"t allow him to hurt me.

name: Genesis 31:8
text: If he said this, "The speckled will be your wages," then all the flock bore speckled. If he said this, "The streaked will be your wages," then all the flock bore streaked.

name: Genesis 31:9
text: Thus God has taken away your father"s livestock, and given them to me.

name: Genesis 31:10
text: It happened during mating season that I lifted up my eyes, and saw in a dream, and behold, the male goats which leaped on the flock were streaked, speckled, and grizzled.

name: Genesis 31:11
text: The angel of God said to me in the dream, "Jacob," and I said, "Here I am."

name: Genesis 31:12
text: He said, "Now lift up your eyes, and behold, all the male goats which leap on the flock are streaked, speckled, and grizzled, for I have seen all that Laban does to you.

name: Genesis 31:13
text: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar, where you vowed a vow to me. Now arise, get out from this land, and return to the land of your birth.""

name: Genesis 31:14
text: Rachel and Leah answered him, "Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father"s house?

name: Genesis 31:15
text: Aren"t we accounted by him as foreigners? For he has sold us, and has also quite devoured our money.

name: Genesis 31:16
text: For all the riches which God has taken away from our father, that is ours and our children"s. Now then, whatever God has said to you, do."

name: Genesis 31:17
text: Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives on the camels,

name: Genesis 31:18
text: and he took away all his livestock, and all his possessions which he had gathered, including the livestock which he had gained in Paddan Aram, to go to Isaac his father, to the land of Canaan.

name: Genesis 31:19
text: Now Laban had gone to shear his sheep: and Rachel stole the teraphim that were her father"s.

name: Genesis 31:20
text: Jacob deceived Laban the Syrian, in that he didn"t tell him that he was running away.

name: Genesis 31:21
text: So he fled with all that he had. He rose up, passed over the River, and set his face toward the mountain of Gilead.

name: Genesis 31:22
text: Laban was told on the third day that Jacob had fled.

name: Genesis 31:23
text: He took his relatives with him, and pursued after him seven days" journey. He overtook him in the mountain of Gilead.

name: Genesis 31:24
text: God came to Laban, the Syrian, in a dream of the night, and said to him, "Take heed to yourself that you don"t speak to Jacob either good or bad."

name: Genesis 31:25
text: Laban caught up with Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mountain, and Laban with his relatives encamped in the mountain of Gilead.

name: Genesis 31:26
text: Laban said to Jacob, "What have you done, that you have deceived me, and carried away my daughters like captives of the sword?

name: Genesis 31:27
text: Why did you flee secretly, and deceive me, and didn"t tell me, that I might have sent you away with mirth and with songs, with tambourine and with harp;

name: Genesis 31:28
text: and didn"t allow me to kiss my sons and my daughters? Now have you done foolishly.

name: Genesis 31:29
text: It is in the power of my hand to hurt you, but the God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, "Take heed to yourself that you don"t speak to Jacob either good or bad."

name: Genesis 31:30
text: Now, you want to be gone, because you greatly longed for your father"s house, but why have you stolen my gods?"

name: Genesis 31:31
text: Jacob answered Laban, "Because I was afraid, for I said, "Lest you should take your daughters from me by force."

name: Genesis 31:32
text: Anyone you find your gods with shall not live. Before our relatives, discern what is yours with me, and take it." For Jacob didn"t know that Rachel had stolen them.

name: Genesis 31:33
text: Laban went into Jacob"s tent, into Leah"s tent, and into the tent of the two female servants; but he didn"t find them. He went out of Leah"s tent, and entered into Rachel"s tent.

name: Genesis 31:34
text: Now Rachel had taken the teraphim, put them in the camel"s saddle, and sat on them. Laban felt about all the tent, but didn"t find them.

name: Genesis 31:35
text: She said to her father, "Don"t let my lord be angry that I can"t rise up before you; for I"m having my period." He searched, but didn"t find the teraphim.

name: Genesis 31:36
text: Jacob was angry, and argued with Laban. Jacob answered Laban, "What is my trespass? What is my sin, that you have hotly pursued after me?

name: Genesis 31:37
text: Now that you have felt around in all my stuff, what have you found of all your household stuff? Set it here before my relatives and your relatives, that they may judge between us two.

name: Genesis 31:38
text: "These twenty years I have been with you. Your ewes and your female goats have not cast their young, and I haven"t eaten the rams of your flocks.

name: Genesis 31:39
text: That which was torn of animals, I didn"t bring to you. I bore its loss. Of my hand you required it, whether stolen by day or stolen by night.

name: Genesis 31:40
text: This was my situation: in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep fled from my eyes.

name: Genesis 31:41
text: These twenty years I have been in your house. I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flock, and you have changed my wages ten times.

name: Genesis 31:42
text: Unless the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, had been with me, surely now you would have sent me away empty. God has seen my affliction and the labor of my hands, and rebuked you last night."

name: Genesis 31:43
text: Laban answered Jacob, "The daughters are my daughters, the children are my children, the flocks are my flocks, and all that you see is mine: and what can I do this day to these my daughters, or to their children whom they have borne?

name: Genesis 31:44
text: Now come, let us make a covenant, you and I; and let it be for a witness between me and you."

name: Genesis 31:45
text: Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.

name: Genesis 31:46
text: Jacob said to his relatives, "Gather stones." They took stones, and made a heap. They ate there by the heap.

name: Genesis 31:47
text: Laban called it Jegar Sahadutha, but Jacob called it Galeed.

name: Genesis 31:48
text: Laban said, "This heap is witness between me and you this day." Therefore it was named Galeed

name: Genesis 31:49
text: and Mizpah, for he said, "Yahweh watch between me and you, when we are absent one from another.

name: Genesis 31:50
text: If you afflict my daughters, or if you take wives besides my daughters, no man is with us; behold, God is witness between me and you."

name: Genesis 31:51
text: Laban said to Jacob, "See this heap, and see the pillar, which I have set between me and you.

name: Genesis 31:52
text: May this heap be a witness, and the pillar be a witness, that I will not pass over this heap to you, and that you will not pass over this heap and this pillar to me, for harm.

name: Genesis 31:53
text: The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge between us." Then Jacob swore by the fear of his father, Isaac.

name: Genesis 31:54
text: Jacob offered a sacrifice in the mountain, and called his relatives to eat bread. They ate bread, and stayed all night in the mountain.

name: Genesis 31:55
text: Early in the morning, Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them. Laban departed and returned to his place.

name: Genesis 32:1
text: Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him.

name: Genesis 32:2
text: When he saw them, Jacob said, "This is God"s army." He called the name of that place Mahanaim.

name: Genesis 32:3
text: Jacob sent messengers in front of him to Esau, his brother, to the land of Seir, the field of Edom.

name: Genesis 32:4
text: He commanded them, saying, "This is what you shall tell my lord, Esau: "This is what your servant, Jacob, says. I have lived as a foreigner with Laban, and stayed until now.

name: Genesis 32:5
text: I have cattle, donkeys, flocks, male servants, and female servants. I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find favor in your sight.""

name: Genesis 32:6
text: The messengers returned to Jacob, saying, "We came to your brother Esau. Not only that, but he comes to meet you, and four hundred men with him."

name: Genesis 32:7
text: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and was distressed. He divided the people who were with him, and the flocks, and the herds, and the camels, into two companies;

name: Genesis 32:8
text: and he said, "If Esau comes to the one company, and strikes it, then the company which is left will escape."

name: Genesis 32:9
text: Jacob said, "God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, Yahweh, who said to me, "Return to your country, and to your relatives, and I will do you good,"

name: Genesis 32:10
text: I am not worthy of the least of all the loving kindnesses, and of all the truth, which you have shown to your servant; for with just my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I have become two companies.

name: Genesis 32:11
text: Please deliver me from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau: for I fear him, lest he come and strike me, and the mothers with the children.

name: Genesis 32:12
text: You said, "I will surely do you good, and make your seed as the sand of the sea, which can"t be numbered because there are so many.""

name: Genesis 32:13
text: He lodged there that night, and took from that which he had with him, a present for Esau, his brother:

name: Genesis 32:14
text: two hundred female goats and twenty male goats, two hundred ewes and twenty rams,

name: Genesis 32:15
text: thirty milk camels and their colts, forty cows, ten bulls, twenty female donkeys and ten foals.

name: Genesis 32:16
text: He delivered them into the hands of his servants, every herd by itself, and said to his servants, "Pass over before me, and put a space between herd and herd."

name: Genesis 32:17
text: He commanded the foremost, saying, "When Esau, my brother, meets you, and asks you, saying, "Whose are you? Where are you going? Whose are these before you?"

name: Genesis 32:18
text: Then you shall say, "They are your servant, Jacob"s. It is a present sent to my lord, Esau. Behold, he also is behind us.""

name: Genesis 32:19
text: He commanded also the second, and the third, and all that followed the herds, saying, "This is how you shall speak to Esau, when you find him.

name: Genesis 32:20
text: You shall say, "Not only that, but behold, your servant, Jacob, is behind us."" For, he said, "I will appease him with the present that goes before me, and afterward I will see his face. Perhaps he will accept me."

name: Genesis 32:21
text: So the present passed over before him, and he himself lodged that night in the camp.

name: Genesis 32:22
text: He rose up that night, and took his two wives, and his two handmaids, and his eleven sons, and passed over the ford of the Jabbok.

name: Genesis 32:23
text: He took them, and sent them over the stream, and sent over that which he had.

name: Genesis 32:24
text: Jacob was left alone, and wrestled with a man there until the breaking of the day.

name: Genesis 32:25
text: When he saw that he didn"t prevail against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh, and the hollow of Jacob"s thigh was strained, as he wrestled.

name: Genesis 32:26
text: The man said, "Let me go, for the day breaks." Jacob said, "I won"t let you go, unless you bless me."

name: Genesis 32:27
text: He said to him, "What is your name?" He said, "Jacob."

name: Genesis 32:28
text: He said, "Your name will no longer be called Jacob, but Israel; for you have fought with God and with men, and have prevailed."

name: Genesis 32:29
text: Jacob asked him, "Please tell me your name." He said, "Why is it that you ask what my name is?" He blessed him there.

name: Genesis 32:30
text: Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for, he said, "I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved."

name: Genesis 32:31
text: The sun rose on him as he passed over Peniel, and he limped because of his thigh.

name: Genesis 32:32
text: Therefore the children of Israel don"t eat the sinew of the hip, which is on the hollow of the thigh, to this day, because he touched the hollow of Jacob"s thigh in the sinew of the hip.

name: Genesis 33:1
text: Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, Esau was coming, and with him four hundred men. He divided the children between Leah, Rachel, and the two handmaids.

name: Genesis 33:2
text: He put the handmaids and their children in front, Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph at the rear.

name: Genesis 33:3
text: He himself passed over in front of them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.

name: Genesis 33:4
text: Esau ran to meet him, embraced him, fell on his neck, kissed him, and they wept.

name: Genesis 33:5
text: He lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, "Who are these with you?" He said, "The children whom God has graciously given your servant."

name: Genesis 33:6
text: Then the handmaids came near with their children, and they bowed themselves.

name: Genesis 33:7
text: Leah also and her children came near, and bowed themselves. After them, Joseph came near with Rachel, and they bowed themselves.

name: Genesis 33:8
text: Esau said, "What do you mean by all this company which I met?" Jacob said, "To find favor in the sight of my lord."

name: Genesis 33:9
text: Esau said, "I have enough, my brother; let that which you have be yours."

name: Genesis 33:10
text: Jacob said, "Please, no, if I have now found favor in your sight, then receive my present at my hand, because I have seen your face, as one sees the face of God, and you were pleased with me.

name: Genesis 33:11
text: Please take the gift that I brought to you, because God has dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough." He urged him, and he took it.

name: Genesis 33:12
text: Esau said, "Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before you."

name: Genesis 33:13
text: Jacob said to him, "My lord knows that the children are tender, and that the flocks and herds with me have their young, and if they overdrive them one day, all the flocks will die.

name: Genesis 33:14
text: Please let my lord pass over before his servant, and I will lead on gently, according to the pace of the livestock that are before me and according to the pace of the children, until I come to my lord to Seir."

name: Genesis 33:15
text: Esau said, "Let me now leave with you some of the folk who are with me." He said, "Why? Let me find favor in the sight of my lord."

name: Genesis 33:16
text: So Esau returned that day on his way to Seir.

name: Genesis 33:17
text: Jacob traveled to Succoth, built himself a house, and made shelters for his livestock. Therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.

name: Genesis 33:18
text: Jacob came in peace to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Paddan Aram; and encamped before the city.

name: Genesis 33:19
text: He bought the parcel of ground where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem"s father, for one hundred pieces of money.

name: Genesis 33:20
text: He erected an altar there, and called it El Elohe Israel.

name: Genesis 34:1
text: Dinah, the daughter of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.

name: Genesis 34:2
text: Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her. He took her, lay with her, and humbled her.

name: Genesis 34:3
text: His soul joined to Dinah, the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the young lady, and spoke kindly to the young lady.

name: Genesis 34:4
text: Shechem spoke to his father, Hamor, saying, "Get me this young lady as a wife."

name: Genesis 34:5
text: Now Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah, his daughter; and his sons were with his livestock in the field. Jacob held his peace until they came.

name: Genesis 34:6
text: Hamor the father of Shechem went out to Jacob to talk with him.

name: Genesis 34:7
text: The sons of Jacob came in from the field when they heard it. The men were grieved, and they were very angry, because he had done folly in Israel in lying with Jacob"s daughter; a which thing ought not to be done.

name: Genesis 34:8
text: Hamor talked with them, saying, "The soul of my son, Shechem, longs for your daughter. Please give her to him as a wife.

name: Genesis 34:9
text: Make marriages with us. Give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves.

name: Genesis 34:10
text: You shall dwell with us, and the land will be before you. Live and trade in it, and get possessions in it."

name: Genesis 34:11
text: Shechem said to her father and to her brothers, "Let me find favor in your eyes, and whatever you will tell me I will give.

name: Genesis 34:12
text: Ask me a great amount for a dowry, and I will give whatever you ask of me, but give me the young lady as a wife."

name: Genesis 34:13
text: The sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father with deceit, and spoke, because he had defiled Dinah their sister,

name: Genesis 34:14
text: and said to them, "We can"t do this thing, to give our sister to one who is uncircumcised; for that is a reproach to us.

name: Genesis 34:15
text: Only on this condition will we consent to you. If you will be as we are, that every male of you be circumcised;

name: Genesis 34:16
text: then will we give our daughters to you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.

name: Genesis 34:17
text: But if you will not listen to us, to be circumcised, then we will take our sister, and we will be gone."

name: Genesis 34:18
text: Their words pleased Hamor and Shechem, Hamor"s son.

name: Genesis 34:19
text: The young man didn"t wait to do this thing, because he had delight in Jacob"s daughter, and he was honored above all the house of his father.
